Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O, children, now that I have completed this book, which is the last of the science of medicine, by dedicating it to its end and by the explanations and declarations within it, it is clear to me that I complete for you here this treatise, which deals with surgical operations.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Since the operation of surgery is widespread in our region and in our times, yet it remains almost entirely private, despite its clear importance and utility; and only some small descriptions are found in the works of the Ancients, which correct many errors and hesitations within them, the understanding of it has been obstructed and its force and art have been diminished.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it is clear to me that I should vivify that order of this treatise according to the way of explanation and declaration and abbreviation; and for it to come in the forms of the tools of cautery and other instruments of the work, through the addition of declaration and preparation, which cause is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	More the reason why a good craftsman does not touch his hand well in this our time is because the art of medicine is long and it covers the actor before this to be exercised in the science of anatomy which Gualia knew among that he was acquainted with the youth of the members and their forms, and the conjunction and separation of them; and had knowledge of the bones, the nerves, and the ligaments, and the number of those, and their qualities; and of the veins pulsating and the quiet ones, and the places of the effusion of them.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for this Hippocrates says that in his name is written, more in the little work, and especially in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	More however we have already spoken of this in the introduction to this book; for who does not know what we said about anatomy, will not be free from error through which many men will die, as I have seen too many of those, for some are formed in this science and fall into that other science and its experiments.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For you saw a foolish and inexperienced doctor who incurred an apostematia escrophilosa in the neck of a woman, and injured some arteries so that great blood flowed until the woman died amidst much suffering.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And there was another doctor who almost performed an extraction of a stone from a man who had been suffering from his condition, and the stone was large, and came to him, and he dried that stone with a piece of bladder, so that that man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I have already called for the extraction of that stone, and I saw that due to the size of the stone and the position of the patient over whom it was located, he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And there was another doctor who took surgical fees from a duke of our land, and he arrived at a blacksmith named Negre who had a fracture in the thigh; and because of the doctor's ignorance, he dried the fracture, over the wound, with pillows and splints with strong structure, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then the dislocation according to his desires, and then the reattachment, and then the drying for several days and commanded that we release the bandage; and thus remained until the thigh and foot became well, and then proceeded to recovery.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and prepared to untie the ligament, and peace and an attempt to alleviate his pains was achieved.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But however, since corruption was confirmed in the member, I could not prevent it, and did not cease to walk the corruption through the member while the illness persisted.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And there was another doctor who incised an malignant abscess, and it ulcerated for several days, during which its malignity increased greatly in the lord of the area.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause is that the pain is purely due to melancholic humors, and does not affect the entire body, but rather affects a member that suffers from being attacked by all.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this reason, my son, it is necessary that you devise the operation in two divisions: one where the operation is associated with health, and another where the work is perilous in its major preparations.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already existed here in all parts of this book where the operation is associated with error and fear; therefore, it is necessary that you keep this and leave the other, so that the leaves do not find a way to speak ill of you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore take your weapons with diligence and protection of God, and your patients with felicity and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way by the grace of God seeking salvation and praiseworthy success, and lay aside the terrible diseases difficult to cure, and remain with your weapons against what frightens you, so that sitting in your faith and in your name you are not overcome: for more remains to your glory, and greater still in this world and beyond in your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Gum disease is observed in some cases:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat disease improperly, so that bad doctors are not named.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have already devoted this livre according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begin the division of the book, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter ordered of the head concerning the feet, in the forms of the instruments and in the tools of the cautery, and of what is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, on drying and perforation, and on cups, and on plaques, and on the extraction of arrows and similar, all categorized and organized by the forms of the instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	The division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and on the healing of tortoises and similar conditions; a chapter organized by the head between the feet, and by the forms of the instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	On the cautery with fire and with sharp medicine, and a reminder of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that, he begins the treatise of the whole book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	I will now describe the quality of the metals used for the cautery and its components, and in which condition a cautery should not be used.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, I say that the discourse on the quality of the cautery metal and its component is long and prolix, subtle by science, and secretly hidden; and much has been spoken about it by wise men, but they are in disagreement. For me, a little from their sermons is enough to avoid lengthy discussions.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore it is said that a cautery is applied to any entire composition universally which is either hot or of a hot nature, except for two compositions, which are gout compositions.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the gouty and dry composition of matter, it desiccates; for some said that a cautery is beneficial for that, while others said the opposite, that a cautery is not convenient in the malady which is due to quality and dryness, for the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is inconvenient that such a malady, being dry and of matter, be healed by what is hot and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And he who says the opposite asserts that by cautery one is healed in all gouty and dry maladies that come into men's bodies, for when you compare the body to its humidity to the composition of fire, you find the body to be hot.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say according to the speech of that person, who has already experienced this several times and discovered it.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But I do not know if it comes to that which is already experienced and exercised in the capital of cautery by recent exercises, and has known the diversity of the composition of people and the disposition of maladies in their members, and the causes of those, and the accidents of them, and the space of time of those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	In other complications, there is no need to fear, and especially in the cold and damp diseases, for all doctors agree on those, and are not divided in using cautery in them.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	Know, sons, that the secret of curing by cautery with fire and its good effect is based on the burning medical cautery, for fire is simple, and its action reaches only the member being cauterized and causes no great harm to other members.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	But the action of the burning medical cautery reaches that part of the member which it touches, and strongly brings to the member pain of difficult healing and strongly sustains it.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, by its sublimity and the goodness of its substance, does nothing but superfluous consume. We already know this from experience and long service in studying the art about the true causes; and for this reason, I excuse myself for the length of my discourse. If it were not that this is not written freely in this pause, and that you secretly keep the qualities of fire's operation on bodies and its expulsion by which you expel diseases, this discourse would be philosophical and demonstrative, suitable for your ears.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, sons, that they disagree about the time at which it is convenient to perform a cautery and when the best season is spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that a cautery is convenient at all times, because the damage from the accidental season is submerged in the youth of what is burned by the cautery, and especially if the cautery is for pains or necessary pains, strong and fistulas, which do not suffer delay because it is feared of those that come malice, which is greater than small damage entering through time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And this is not done on your feet, sons, for they do not consider it except by the common people and the foolish doctors, since for that illness that is cured by cautery it is not convenient at all times, and they pause that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the reason is not like this they consider it, for a cautery is not but in place of a medicine which alters the composition and dries the humors which are the cause of the wind's pains.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	Yet, however, an excess cautery over medicine for the swiftness of its virtue and power of its operation and greatness of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that his illness returns at some point in time, according to the complexity of the illness and the location of his illness, and its virtue, and what is prepared in his body from the aggregation of superfluities in him, and what is obtained by him in his acquisition through food and semblances of those causes; but the illness in which cautery is administered is a subtle illness in a member with few superfluities and humidities, just as cautery for toothache due to pain and similar to that, it is possible that that pain does not return in it, more so when it is done in small amounts.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And more commonly said is that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and it is a layman's saying, not what we understand by it, for I believe that it is not a cure that benefits either medicine or any other cause except cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the reason is the opposite; and I understand that cautery is the last remedy of medicine only when one administers the methods of cure for some illnesses, and those medicines do not help, and near the end of the cause, one administers cautery, and it benefits then.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And here from this point cautery is the last remedy of medicine, not according to understanding which I understand of the vulgar and too many of the foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that a golden cautery is better than an iron one, and they did not say this because of the equality of gold and the sublimity of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place for cautery does not burn, since it is not absolutely heated, for I have already tried this and tested that it works only in some bodies and not in others. A golden cautery is good and better than iron as they say; but when you make a cautery with fire of gold, it is not up to you to declare, for it ignites according to the quantity you want due to the hardness of the gold, and prepares to receive heat; and if you adjust over the ignition, the gold melts by the fire, and some sheets remain in the fire for the craftsman to cut through the occupation of that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this, you should make the cautery of iron lighter and more precisely to the right position during the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already ordered this chapter on the cautery according to other chapters, and I have ordered those of the thigh between the legs, so that I delay the requesting party what he wants from him.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of the cautery for headaches due to cold and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery addresses the cold and humidity over the servel accident of which there are two causes, which cause soda and much traumatic flux, called corissa, from the head to the parts of the hollows and of the ears flowing, and much sleeping, and toothache, and colic, and universally all illness that comes through coldness, thus as paralytically, soda, and apoplexy, and similar signs in those illnesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cautery is as follows: first, I command the patient to be evacuated with a laxative medicine for three or four nights, according to the strength of the patient, the age of the patient, and his custom.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command him to shave his head with a razor, and place that razor between your hands on a sloping bench so that he places his hands on his own foot.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place the razor from your palm against his cheek between his fingers.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	More importantly, since the correct location has been determined, mark that location with a probe, and then heat the olive cautery of which this is the form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that cautery over the marked location with a probe, in such a way that it descends gradually, and you rotate it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand lightly and look at the location. If you see any part of the bone being revealed, as much as a grain of barley, then raise your hand. If not, return your hand to that iron, or another one if it is cooled, until what I have said can be seen on the bone.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve it over the location and leave it there for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Then place your hand over the inguinal area where the fire scar is destroyed, and leave that hand on the inside.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	Then apply a tetra-pharmaceutical salve to the area until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And we have already said that when the wound is opened wide, it heals better, because it is healthier and more beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some of them say that the ankle should be cauterized inside the bone, and that the cautery should remain until part of the bone is burned.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	Then scrape away what is burned from the bone, and then treat it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others say that the cautery should reach the marrow, pressing strongly into the bone until it cools, and this is the method of Alphécat, petit.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they believe that from that location the vapors of the head expire.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And keep the wound open for a long time, and then treat it until it is healed and consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But these two types of cautery I have not seen in all my days, except in some men according to a fear-based method; leave that one, I advise you, it is better for health when possible; for the head is heated by the solution of continuity of itself as we have testified in other members, and especially when the head of the patient is of cold nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first type of cautery is safer and better, I advise you; use that one and do so for health.

Del cauteri del cap.	Of the cautery for the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When chronic and long-lasting pain occurs in the entire head of the patient, and this is prolonged in the patient, and the patient uses towels, pillows, head poultices, plasters, bandages, cold compresses, and warm compresses, and especially if the head has already been cauterized with a cautery that does not relieve it from any of these causes, consider whether the head of the patient is of strong constitution in its nature; and since it is not cold, do not find much freg (irritation). In such cases, use another type of cautery and leave the previous one a little.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that on the corner of his head with a cautery between where the seam is split.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Incise the seam and the quantity of the mouth which we have counted, and cauterize that with a cautery at the back part of the head in the place which is called vas, — and this is the place where suction is applied.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And raise your hand here, but do not uncover the mouth, for the patient finds great pain different from the pain of all other head cauteries.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I will say this cautery in its place, for I know that the cautery on which one cauterizes the corners of the head and the occiput is a finer cautery than that on which one cauterizes the middle part of the head; and this is the form of it.

De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of the cautery for ancient headache.

Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the cautery for the tortoise shell.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	The tortoise shell, which is cured and treated with cautery only involves substances that the wind humors pass through, as we have said in the divisions of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cautery for the substance that passes due to drying or spasms of the nerve.

E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	Then cover the area with what is described and leave it to heal.

De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On the cauterization for nasal odor.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When your treatment for nasal odor, as we have discussed in the division, does not improve, then you prepare and give to the patient to drink three nights a decoction of chicory; and shave his head, and cauterize it with a medium-sized cautery and an olive oil cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And cauterize that with a carnation cautery on both eyebrows, leaving the hair slightly singed.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to burn that area.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And the carnation cautery is used in this way.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the cautery for softening the eyelids of the eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by illness or humidity, then cauterize that eyelid with a cautery of this lunar cautery; and this is its form:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you, cauterize that over the two eyebrows with a little from two cauteries in all parts, and they be long from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the size of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too much with your hand on the cautery, but according to the amount that the inner part of the eyelid is adhered.
Capitol .xvi.	Capitol. XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Of the cautery for the eyelid of the eye when the skin is converted in the inner parts and fistula of the eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the skin of the eye is converted in the inner parts, if I puncture the eye, cauterize there according to two methods: either with a cautery or with burning medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If the cautery is from fire, command the patient before applying it to their skin as if those that cleanse them, after they are extended and equalized; and when you hold that [cautery], you strengthen its edge with a bandage so that it does not hurt until the skin is grown.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	So when they are grown and equalized, then place the head of the cautery in the patient's mouth, and closely touch the edge of the cautery to the skin, marking it with a symbol resembling the shape of an olive leaf, which is the beginning of the mark on the skin.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	Then closely press it in beef fat or in mucus of blister on the wound.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	Then ignite the cautery of which this is the form.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	Then cauterize over the figure which is marked, little by little with small grains, until the surface of the wound is burned which is like an olive leaf, entirely apparent properly.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And a sign of health from your work is that you see the eyelid of the eye already contracted and the skin around it raised, indicating successful treatment.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And raise your hand and let it be for three days, then place it over the wound between where the scar should be eradicated.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And apply ointment there until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if it returns through the skin for some cause near their origin and the eyelid becomes softened, then make another time the cautery over that area as you did first.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the skin is on the eyelid, then cauterize that until it rises to its natural place and remains equal, ensuring the skin does not touch the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery with burning medicine is that you command the patient to let the skin remain stretched and equal, then make it of linen cloth the shape of a bay leaf.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take known soap and fresh cow urine, or what is equivalent to this, and mix these ingredients well, doing so quickly to prevent it from being diluted; then spread this over the cloth which is made thus in the shape of a mulberry leaf, and place that over one or both; place the other end closed in a bag of flax, and the thigh of the patient in the middle.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place the said part on the medicine and press it slightly so that the patient feels the bite of the medicine, for the bite is like that of fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And so, when the patient perceives that the bite of the medicine, let the medicine off and place it again on the thigh as said; therefore, when the bite ceases, then put the medicine back on and wash the area with water; then consider if the eyelid has already been lifted; if it is washed like this, apply heat or incision, for then it is good; and if not, return to applying the medicine to the place where it was not pressed, without disturbing your operation and contracting the area.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	Then place your hand over the groin area between which the adhesion should be removed, and cure that with an ointment or something else in which it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And you must, with due vigilance, guard the wound from falling into disuse of medicine, and if the eyelid itself for some days becomes softened or any cause affects the skin around it, then repeat your medicine on that place where the eyelid has become softened, and proceed in this manner as at the beginning, and soon let it heal.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	This is the way of using the hawthorn leaf.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that the wounds of men vary according to their size and extent, and therefore according to this you should make your incision.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And the way of right treatment for those who study in this art should not be hidden.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cautery treatment of a fistula in the lacrimal duct of the wound.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat fistula as we have said in the divisions of diseases and do not apply your treatment accordingly, then when you cauterize it in this manner: command the patient to place his head on your knee, and let a minister hold the back of his head between your knees in such a way that it is neither hurt nor agitated.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place the hot cloth or the blistering material on the heel of the foot.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then heat the cautery, and this is its form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which is cylindrical, as it forms like a cane or a bird's feather quill, from one end of which the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if sharp, penetrate into the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want, let it be straight like a needle.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, that which is concave is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press the fistula if it is opened, and draw from it clean and dry it out.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not opened, then open it and extract the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then place the well-ignited cautery over it, and hold your hand a little above the nose, so that your hand does not err or the patient be at peace, and then place the cautery on the cheeks and corrupt that area.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so, if at the beginning of your cautery it enters into the mouth, that is good; and if not, then reapply the cautery one or two times, as needed; and leave it thus for three days, and then place your hand over that spot to keep it warm and surround it with an ointment that is dry until it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	And if ten days have passed and it is not healed, then place your hand over the sharp corrosive medicine until the bone is revealed and is scraped as you see fit in your treatise.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And another way to cauterize a fistula, which some first doctors said: find the place of the fistula and do it there, then place yourself over that fissure as if with a thin probe which is its form; then put in there the quantity of one uncia of melted lead; and keep your hand tightly, so that the bad humor does not enter where the melted lead does not reach; and pause over the opening of the bad humor like immersed in white of an egg or water, for lead adheres to the place of the fistula and heals it through a marvelous cure.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed as we have said of the cauterization and cure, that is good; but if not, then it is necessary to administer a nasal draught and reduce the fistula into the nose cavity according to its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the cauterization of the wound from the boil.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Motes (or small openings) that occur in the lips, and more frequently in the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Then, when you cure those fissures as we have said in the divisions and your cure does not take effect, then heat the small surgical cautery according to this form that is taught:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	Let the cavity be according to the subtlety of the blade.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then place that hot cautery in those fissures until the heat reaches the base of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	Then cure that with cerote until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On the cautery treatment of a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the root of the uvula or on the palate or in the roots of the teeth an abscess forms, and soon bursts, and is old, and a channel is formed, and you cure it but the cure does not take effect, then heat the cautery according to the quantity received in the fistula, place that heated instrument into the tract of the fistula, and with your hand ensure that the burning iron reaches the base of it. Do this one or two times; then cure that as we have said for the cure until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And so if the abscess is incised and healed, that is good; otherwise, it is necessary to uncover the place and treat the corrupted bone according to what will come in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	capitol.xx.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Cauterization of the teeth and softening of the gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by humidity and the teeth are loose, and you have cured those with medicines and not applied them, then place the head of the patient in the basin of water, and quickly heat the cautery into the shape which will be given shortly. Test that you pause the cautery over the tooth and insert it there rapidly, ensuring that the patient feels the heat from the fire to reach the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And lift your hand, and repeatedly apply the cautery several times according to your desire.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And make the patient spit out the salt water and hold it for an hour, then stop, as the loose tooth is now closed, the softened gum tightened, and the corrupted humidity dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Cauterization for tooth pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is due to inflammation or decay, or if medical treatment does not relieve the pain, then cauterization of that area can be performed in two ways: either with a cauterizer made from ox horns, or with a hot iron.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterization with ox horn is done by taking a horn from an ox and filling it with hot iron. Then, take some cress or other herb and wrap it around the tip of the horn, immerse that part filled with the hot iron into the cress or herb, and place it over the painful tooth, pressing firmly to ensure it cools before being applied to avoid further irritation.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeatedly apply it several times to ensure that the heat from the fire reaches the root of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you do, immerse a piece of wool or cloth in the horn as mentioned above, and place that over the painful tooth. Then hold the hot iron inside until the heat reaches the root of the tooth's cavity.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	Moreover, however, the cautery with fire, you must attend to the small opening of skin or of iron, and in its core there should be some coarse substance so that the sharpness of the fire does not reach the entrance of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then shape the cautery as it will come, and place that over the tooth and put your hand inside so that the cautery is well rubbed; and do this several times to prevent the pain from worsening on that day or the next.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And ensure that due to the impression of that cautery, the patient opens their mouth wide and keep it that way for one hour; this is the form of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cautery the area where you wish to stop the bleeding as much as is possible.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the form of the catheter:

De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On the cautery for hoarseness and constriction of the windpipe.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut. Capitol .xxv.	Capitol.xxv.
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	Of the cautery for titillium, which is the head of the helper.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	When the head of the helper is dislocated due to lubricating humidity and is not fixed at the time of its return, you should reduce its dislocation while it is about to naturally return, and then with a slight movement it is displaced so that it seeks to return, as we have testified. When first reducing the dislocation, place the patient's head on their back or on their side; then lift the neck which is in the inner part of the clavicle with the upper parts near your left hand, if the joint is dislocated towards the inner part.
E aprop igneys le cauteri havent dos caps; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then heat the cautery having two heads; this is its form:

De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	On the Perforation of an Abscess on the Foot with a Cautery.
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When there is an inflammation or abscess in the buttock and you want to know if that abscess is in the flesh of the buttock or in its skin, then if it is in the flesh of the buttock, the patient will experience increased gravity and pain severity.
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	And if it is in the skin of the buttock, then the pain will be severe and often causes great fatigue to the doctors treating it.

And you should only use the cautery of those whose study in the art of medicine is extensive, and for whom many diseases are known. De cauterizacio de plauresi.	Of cautery for the thigh.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	They said that the ancient cautery for the thigh should be made according to this manner: take from the bark of the aristolia tree a long stick, which is found there, and let it have the thickness of a finger.
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas. When venous blood and humidity are present in the vagina, it is forbidden to conceive, and the menstrual flow is corrupted, and conception is delayed. When joint pain occurs due to this condition, then cauterize the area with three cauteries around the umbilical region, as we have said in the treatment of the bladder; and place a cautery at the lower part of the foot, or use two cauteries, and use a thigh cautery.

De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	Of the cautery for the dislocation of the ankle.
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When moist phlegm infiltrates the area around the ankle, and causes displacements of its location, a sign of this is that the swelling extends over the other foot when compared between them.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	And the location of the dislocation is treated on the side that is swollen.

De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	Of the cautery treatment for the sciatic vein.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain in the leg is caused by cold and humidity, the patient is treated with what we have said, and you do not apply any of the ancient methods where you would cause the patient to suffer from large humors through foul pills or artificial ones; instead, cautery the affected area.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	The method of cautery for this is according to two methods: either with burning medicines, or with fire.

E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	And for the surgical cautery, the depth of the cauterization should be according to the intensity of the pain.

E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio. E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	And then follows a strong solution for the belly, and then death.

E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc. Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	Nevertheless, the best cautery for medicines that adhere is to make two circles having a perforated frame in which the smoke from the iron door passes; let the length of the walls where they are be two nuts or quarters.

E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	And ensure that you place the nourishment according to the length of the healing time of the wound which closes his abdomen, and that the intestine does not come out with the great effort to heal.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And after, when you want to lift it after 10 days, then administer the ointment decently made, and keep it for other 10 days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And let it rest from work and replenishment of food and drink, and of strong voices, for when it uses this regimen of healing entirely, it will be cured.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And I will say the healing of ruptures in other parts of the abdomen, and at the beginning, if you want them not to tear, then cauterize the rupture with a round cautery according to its quantity. And this should be what is drawn from the codena as the tender part of it; then after care for it as we have said, and it should not be tightened.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	And some first ones have said that rupture should be cauterized with a triangular cautery according to this form, rather than with forceps.
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	And a line is placed there for the width in the legs and passes over the rupture, another line above it; then place your hand on a cruciform cautery, but the first cautery is lighter and better.
Capitol .xlvi.	Capitol. XLVI.
De cauterizacio de torcio.	Of the cauterization of the torchio.
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When pain persists in some members due to adhesion or percussion and does not respond to medical treatment over a long period, then you should cauterize with a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	And the cautery should be of the size and shape appropriate to the member, its heat and intensity, and the location and pain of the torchio.
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	Then if it is healed with the first cautery, that is good; otherwise, repeat the cautery on it. For customarily, those pains are pierced in a neighboring member to the affected one, so that you may achieve healing through the cautery before the disease is cured.
Capitol .xlvii.	Capitol forty-seven.
De cauterizacio de lepra.	Of the cautery for leprosy.
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	The lepers are sometimes treated with a large cautery for a long time, and moderately if the species of leprosy is caused by the putrefaction of flame and melancholy.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	And therefore, if you want to cautery that area, consider whether the leprosy is common and similar to that cured as we have said in the division and neither this nor that, and fear that the corruption may encompass his entire body and all its parts. Then cautery that area on the head with five cauteries: one in the middle of the head, and the second at the side; place the front near the end of the hairline; two on the horns; and one behind, on the neck or servant.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And finish your hand with the cautery a little before it enters the mouth, creating a small impression, so that the expiration of thick vapors is alleviated; and cautery on the cheek as needed.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	If leprosy is already spread over the patient and manifest clearly, then when you cauterize that area or those cauterizations which we said in the head; do so on the tip of the nose, and two cauterizations on the two moustaches, and two on two vertebrae of the neck, and six on the vertebrae of the back, and one large one near the coccyx, and one on the spine, and two on the flanks, and one on each flank, and two on the hips and one on each hip, and two on the knees, and two on the muscles, and two on the tendons of their feet; cauterize that on all joints of their fingers and their toes, and on each heel of their feet, and on their nails.
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	And guard the nerves which are over the heel that you do not burn those.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	And sometimes cauterization is done with one cauterization on the bone of the pelvis and another on the mouth of the stomach, and another on the diaphragm.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	And you should know that the more tightly you adjust the cautery, the more beneficial and effective it is; and you should know that the patient does not feel pain in the cautery, as do those on the surface, because so the patient's body is already numbed.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	And know that the cauteries should be large or small according to the members and joints as preceded by the species of the instruments.
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the cautery with a paste of roasted wheat flour and honey, and other treatments until it is healed.

De cauterizacio de stupor.	On the cautery for stupor.
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	When some member is numbed or asleep and is treated with medicines, oils, and plasters, and does not heal, then you cautery that numb member with cauteries according to the size of the member or its smallness.
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	And let your cautery penetrate the thickness of the skin slightly.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that which is ointed until it is healed.
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor. This causes the inflammation of the nerves which run through that member, and it alleviates the pain.
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	But do not apply it indiscriminately, but only to those who are skilled in the anatomy of the limbs and the course of the nerves throughout the body.

De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	On the cautery treatment for swellings that become morphew.
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	When the swelling is old and does not respond to any of the medical ointments, then cauterize over it with a cautery for a small amount according to the quantity of the size of the swelling until the whiteness and the color of it are changed.

De cauterizacio de cranc.	Of cautery for the knee.
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	When cancer begins and you want to stop it, then cautery the area with a circular cautery along the circumference of the lesion as it is revolved.

De cauterizacio de adubilati.	Of cautery for adenitis.
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio. Capitol .lii.	Chapter II.
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	On the cautery for corruption.
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	Corruption is a spreading decay in the member, which eats away at it like fire consumes dry wood.
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	Therefore, if you see corruption in a place where the cautery with fire will be applied, then heat the cautery with several small and large flames as appropriate for that place where there is corruption.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	And then cauterize that completely after you have removed all the corruption and do not leave any cause of it.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	And leave that for three days, and place a warm oil mixture over the cauterized areas until all the scars are completely eradicated and all the corruption is gone.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	And then cure that with ointment producing flesh.
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	But if after three days the flesh grows healthy in the area where there is no corruption, that is good; but if not, then re-cauterize the area that is rotten in the corrupted locations.
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	And if the lesion is treated several times with sharp medicine, which is half the use of cauterization.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	But however, cauterization with fire is more beneficial than light ointment.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And I have already described the treatment with sharp medicine in the division, so use it when you need it.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter 33.
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	On the Cauterization of Ulcers and Similar Conditions.
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Small stones found in the foot of the sick that are called clavus, and this is a large cause, penetrating, which affects the foot; and cautery for these is according to two methods, one is cautery by fire and one is cautery by hot water.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	And the cautery by fire is that you heat the concave cauterizer shaped like a needle point, which is made of iron according to the quantity it can contain the stone from all parts, and it should have fine edges.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	And then place that heated instrument over the stone, and quickly move your hand with the cautery in a circle around the stone while the cautery reaches the depth of the stone.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	And let it be there for three days until it begins to heal.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	And then apply a poultice to it using wild thyme boiled in salt water, and let the poultice remain on it for one night, so that the stone is eliminated by its roots.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with a cream of generative flesh until it heals.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	If so non-conductive, and motes viewed occur in the surface of the body, mainly in the thighs and feet, then when you administer there with cautery moistened, take a lancet of iron or of steel or of bone, place that over the nail; and bring into the lancet of moisture a small quantity, withdraw your hand, and you revolve that by compression of your hand from all sides, and press the margin of the cannula on the root of the nail, and you will find the moisture flows through the channel of the nail; wait for the patient a little by the bite of the moisture for an hour, and then withdraw that, since the nail has its channels eroded.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And thus apply them to those and then to the other, over all of which they are in the body.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	And then cure those boils where the nail's channels have been eroded with ointments the flesh gets infected.

De cauterizacio de tremor.	Of cautery for trembling.
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When there is a tremor due to friction in the nerves or fever of that cause, or for another similar reason, then you should cautery it with four or five cauteries on the spine, placing one cautery between each vertebra; and one on the foot, and one over its stomach.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And the tremor subsides, and the illness improves with this treatment.

De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	Of cautery for ailments affecting the body.
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When in the body there are abscesses and pustules, which are made of gross corrupt substances; then at the beginning as they appear, they should be cauterized over the entire length of the fistula with a fine cautery, the end of which is extended over fire; or with a piece of erystologia longua; or with a lentil-shaped cautery.
