Capitol lvi.	Capitol lvi.
De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	Of the cautery for flux of sand accident by incision of artery.
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Many times, after an injury to the artery that is incised, along the wound which runs through, or from the incision of abscesses or cautery on the member, then the flow seems difficult to stop.
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	Then, when such a thing happens to any artery, hold your hand over the orifices of the artery and place it there strongly for many times until the flow of the blood stops, then remove it, so that it does not leak.
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	And place the olive cautery firmer for a few and larger times, by many strokes, and blow on them until they are ignited.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	And then take one small or large, according to the place and wound where the artery is broken, over that vein strongly press after you have retracted as I said before, and put the cautery where it may be cut and restricted that blood.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if the blood is expelled from the opening of the artery when you retract as I said and press the cautery strongly, then take another cautery prepared among the cauteries that are in the fire, and therefore do not cease to do this one after another until the blood is restricted.
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And take care that you do not burn the nerves here, and that no other evil comes to the patient.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And know that when blood flows from the artery, it is not possible to restrict the blood with a cautery, especially when the artery is large, unless one of four methods is used: either with a cautery as we said, or with extraction when it is not removed, or when it is removed, its ends are burned and the blood is restricted, or with ligation using salt or gravel for strong constriction, or with pressure using a poultice with proper compression.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	But he who administers sufficient restraint to the patient with flax and by binding or through the position of burning causes and similar, will not fare well.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	But if he has to do so for someone and neither the doctor is present nor medicine, then open gently with the finger indicated over the opening of that vein as we have said, and understand the great compression within which the wound has remained from the upper part of the wound, and above the arch let the vein not be compressed; and above the arch let water infused with a strongly cold fomentation be applied before the wound is closed and made thicker; and more cauterize or medicate as necessity demands.
Comensa la segonda partida.	Begin the second part.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Of incision and perforation and venesection and of bleeding and of wounds and their appearances.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the words of Albucazis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have already said in the first chapter all disease in which cauterization with fire is convenient and medicaments that burn, and the occasions and causes of it, and the instruments necessary for those cauterizations; and I have ordered the chapters from the upper part of the head to the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And you shall proceed in this chapter in that manner, so that the one seeking this may be relieved of what he has asked for.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And before you begin this, learn, sons, that in this chapter we treat of the fear mentioned in the first chapter of cautery.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And because you must be in great caution, for in the operation which is in this chapter, many cases of evacuation occur which can lead to death; you must perform the aspersion of the vein or incision on the abscess or pustule, or perforation of the exsanguination or purgation of the wound or extraction of an arrow and incision for pus, and similar procedures.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And in all of these, there is fear and trembling, and in the majority of them, death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I warn you that this applies to you in the position where it is situated, for sometimes cases occur where your methods differ from those of unskilled practitioners.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And some of them will go to seek their illness and die easily because of the intensity of what they find in their illness, and for the length of the illness, and from the illness which means death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And of them, some will give to you their advice and say, "You should expect that from that which cures, the illness is harmful.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	And so be sure that you consent to only those who come to you with this manner; and let your caution be greater than covetousness and your greed; and do not presume on any cause except for certain knowledge which verifies what you must do, and to which a worthy success will lead.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And use in the cure of all your illnesses based on prognosis and indication of the one to whom health has been converted; for in that is help for you in the acquisition of fame and memory, glory and renown.

E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And I have also set out this chapter distinguishing it into chapters as previously explained in the chapter on cautery, concerning the cure from head to feet, so that what you seek and require may be alleviated.
Capitol primier.	First chapter.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	Of the cure of water that is contained in the head of the child.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	Know that this illness often appears in children during childbirth and when the mother's body strengthens the child's head, its condition improves.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And sometimes it appears for hidden causes that are unknown.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels. E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And if the humidity is much increased and the abscess is larger, then here make two fissures in this manner:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the humidity is on the bone, the sign is that you feel the edges of the tendon gaping apart and the water exudes when you compress it with your hand on the inside parts; this is not what you want to see.

e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat. Capitol .ii.	Chapter II.

And what comes from spitting blood is a quantity of one uncia, and heavier or lighter than its normal weight, and all this is according to the quantity which appears from the virtue of the malady and the fullness of the artery of the same.

Capitol .iii.	Chapter III.
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	On the extraction of the arteries which are in the temples.

Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	Of the cure for what affects the ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia. E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And when a boil appears in the ear or another cause seeming like those causes that do not adjust or swell in the ear, and you place the ear in the sun, and if times the boil, then it distills in that some cause of viola oil or sesame, and then administer its extraction, and make him sneeze with a condition, and plug his nostrils to prevent sneezing.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And then place some pieces of cloth or wool in the circuit of the ear, and extend the ear to the parts above, where motas (small particles) are often found due to these causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is not cured, then administer the extraction of it with the instrument called gesti epicicarios subtil, of which this is the form:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it is cured with the gesti, well done; and if not, then administer the extraction of it with the fine onci of little duplication.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And if it is not cured by this, then make a cannula of wire and insert the end of the cannula into the tract of the ear and close around the cannula with wax and with oil softened so that it does not swell except the cannula.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And then extract the thigh muscle with strong traction, for too tight ligaments as we have recounted.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	And if it is not loosened in this manner, then take a sharp instrument or a previously prepared one with which the arteries are clamped with a small quantity, place that at the extremity of the ray, and then properly wrap around that knot.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And then insert that into the tract of the ear with ease, and then dry the ear of its moisture.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And if it is not loosened by all the causes we have recounted, then you cut to excise that which tends to become an abscess or spasm.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the way to cut it is that at the beginning you touch the evil of the vein superficially and extract it according to the manner of its virtue, then make a incision between your fingers and convert the ear to the parts above, and make a small fissure in the back of the ear and place the skin there.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And let the fissure of lunar shape reach to the heel, and, if the heel is blackened, obstruct it if possible with appropriate instruments; then place the fissure in that hour with speed, and cure it while it is sound.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the cause settles in the ear is one of those waxes that build up and are inflamed, then administer the cure and extraction of it; but if it does not yield to your attempt, then take thin subtle spatum according to this form:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	And administer the extraction of that wax which has settled in the ear.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not do this when you think that it is already moistened by the vapor of the ear, and place it on fine wicks, and for extraction use either gentle pressure or incision as we have said, for this alleviates the extraction.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But in the water which has entered into the ear canal that the patient uses for sneezing with a condition at the beginning, and fills her ear with a little old rag, and places it over the ear in which is the water, and if by this it is forced out, well; but otherwise, then take ten or twelve pieces of lead and lion's teeth according to the length of the finger, and heat those in the fire a little, and the patient inserts one of them into her ear canal and sits over a piece of that part and strikes with another stone upon the stone which is inside the ear.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	Therefore continue to apply heat until all the water has been expelled.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc i, e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And when the water has been sufficiently expelled, take a piece of paper or cloth, and place one end in the ear and extend the other end into the fire until the paper is ignited.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And place another cloth and do this several times until all the water has been expelled, then remove it with a suction tube as previously described.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	In the extraction of a small foreign body entering that ear, proceed with more caution and according to what we have said in the division. But if it is a large object causing an immediate sensation, then perform the extraction quickly and with precision; the cause is less severe compared to all other causes found in the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	In the extraction of a worm generated in the ear, when you treat it as we have said in the division and in the treatise on distillations, and if your treatment does not show results, then look into the ear with the sun shining.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore if any cause of worms appears here, then extract that with forceps or fine tweezers, but if no cause appears, then take a catheter and stretch it wide, this is its form:
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	I insert the narrow end into the ear according to the amount that the patient can bear; and then I extract it by strong suction, performing this several times until all the worms are extracted.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	But if it does not respond to your attention, then you plug and close the circuit of the catheter with wax as we have said; then administer distillations which have already proven effective in the treatment of worms, and you will find this in the treatise on distillations.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And let your application be with that which you will pour medical oils into the ear with this instrument, which is its form:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	And make it of silver or copper, straight, with a small tube, and a flat surface above.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And therefore they should push so that it is in the cavity of the catheter here where it will be necessary.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you want, take the ray and wrap it decently around its extremity, then insert oil into the cavity of the ear, or the juice of some herb, or any medicine you wish — and that is in the auricle —, and place the ray carefully over it and squeeze your hand with gentle pressure so that the oil is expelled into the cavity of the ear and the malady feels the oil inside.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And what is infused in the ear should already be heated over fire for a little while.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And make sure that the medicine you will distill in the ear is not too hot, for ear medicines do not tolerate this.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	On the cure of perforations of the ears.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Sometimes children of unperforated ears inherit them from their parents, and this happens in some people. Perforation occurs in the ear meat due to a wound or no tissue at all; sometimes this perforation is in the pars petrotica of the ear, which does not contain cartilage, and sometimes it is in the external parts.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And that which occurs in the region of the loins, which does not admit inspection, is in the major disposals of difficult recovery.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in that where you can see it, check that you place the patient's ear in the sun and look at it.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if you see an apparent swelling, open that small incision under which this swelling is located:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the extremity of the swelling where the width is small, and one part is acute while the other is not; and the incision be made with two lancets to prevent it from causing harm to the ear.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And if the obstruction is due to hidden flesh in the ear or in the meat of the ear, then make those small incisions and cut vigorously enough to remove all the flesh.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the obstruction is in the region of the ear, then take a small lancet and heat that piece of iron slightly in the fire, and then place it on the flesh of the ear.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And so, if you sense an abundance of fluid that the patient experiences with ease due to the weightiness of excretion, relieve the pressure on it by easing; and be sure not to injure the nerves of the ear.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then place a cloth on the ear according to the amount of swelling you have wrapped in Egyptian ointment; and do this for several days until you are sure of the healing of the swelling; or take some and insert it into water and powder it over which you apply the dried trissemum, using it; and if you see that the ear has already become flaccid, then scoop out what you have damaged and replace it with another substance which you wrap in a cloth made of rubbed oil, until the abscess is drained; and cure it as it heals.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	But if a blood flow occurs, then submerge a sponge or cloth in cold water and place it over the ear, and use the other treatment which constricts the flow of blood, which is called in the treatise on distillation.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	For the cure of a boil that occurs on the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Boils that occur on the eyelids sometimes become wet, at other times they are dry.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Then take those that you have heated or boiled, and dissolve those in the foam of their juice, and place it over the areas after boiling.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	But if there is pain with a flow of black bile, then cauterize those areas with a thin cautery.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cautery is near the incisions, and the wounds heal when there remains any cause of their juice; and when they are cauterized with fire, those juices are burned and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	For the cure of a great boil that occurs on the eyelids.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Boils that occur on the eyelids sometimes appear with a cause which, in its strength and hardness, is like a great boil, and for this reason it is called a great boil.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And it is an addition of large humidity in the eyelid below and above.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	And the operation in this case is that you consider whether the swelling is present in it where appears from the eyelid and is augmented at all parts; and the cause of it is slight.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	And make a incision for its width, and then probe it from all parts with ease so that the fluid evacuates, and suspend it by a needle and cut it off.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if you do not have means to make an incision there, so instead you penetrate the eyelid with a small incision little by little, then you do this without any cause.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the figure is large, then you adjust it with sutures; and cure it so that it heals.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is small, you will not suffer harm from it because the ointment restores and heals it.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the swelling is decreasing inside the eyelid, you should probe the inside surface, and then drain the eyelid. Suspend the swelling by a needle, or one that you choose to make an incision with, and press it from all parts. If the eyelid is stretched by an incision, you do this without any cause.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And at the beginning, wash the area with salt water; and cover the place with water until it is healed.
Capitol .x.	Capitol.
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	For the cure of excision in the upper eyelid.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	Excision is caused by grease that is generated in the tunic of the upper eyelid, especially among children, who aggravate their ailments and may die from it; they cannot look at the clarity of the sun for this reason, and tears begin to flow.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And for this reason, you see them weep on their cheeks all the time, and they sleep with their faces in their hands. Over their cheeks where their eyebrows meet, there is moisture due to swelling, and the imminent need for excision is apparent in the eye; and when you press the area with hot objects, you feel the excision between them.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	And some method of operation is in that the patient rests their head on a hot object, then places a cloth around them and makes a circular incision according to the quantity it contains from all parts. Then place this over that and press with hot objects so that excision is aggregated in the middle of the circle. And in the middle of that moisture, make an incision perpendicular to the width, and let the incision not be greater than the incision made in a flaskotomy.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	More in the prepone cough that you make the incision totally until you reach arcernach, for in the most serious cases proceed with an incision according to the form of white grease.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Therefore, extract those from the cloths which you have wrapped around your thighs and remove them between your hands right and left until they are dispersed.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And make sure you do not press on the incision so that you do not plug it and leave it open.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	More if your alternach does not appear at the beginning of the incision, more that you press on the incision a little with a cloth to prevent it from closing; then extract those as we said; and place wet cloths under the area and strengthen them with powder.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And so soak it with salt and place it in the cavity of the incision to prevent what remains of that humidity.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And cure it until it is healed.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	But if an abscess occurs in that place, then cure it by applying cauterized flax cloths until it heals.
Capitol .xi.	Capitol. xi.
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	Methods of palpation of the whole body.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When in the eyelids of the eye so close set lesions make the natural skin swell and become inflamed, then those nosos [nodules] on the eye become ways of ailments such as constant tearing and softening of the eyelids and conjunctiva before this is a cause of destruction of the eye, which is called tactinir del huel. And it is cured in four ways: either by cautery with fire; or by acute medicine as previously said in the Capitol on cautery; or it is done by incision and suturing; or by canthiresses as I will say later.
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	And then cover that the head of the eye in your right hand; then convert the eyelid of the eye with your left hand. If it is converted, good; and if not, insert a needle into that part where it is attached to the eyelid, and drive the needle with thread above, and let this be—near the margin of the eyelid where the skin arises—and near the skin, and pull the thread towards the parts above the eyelid, and convert that with the flame.
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt.	And then in the inner part of the eyelid, place the skin tightly against the aqueous humor of the major lacrimal gland entering the minor lacrimal gland; and then extract the fatty substance and place on the eyelid a powder of coto or cloth dust, and then cover the eyelid with a tent, as in the figure of a leaf of myrtle.
Mays empero cove que sia la figura segon la quantitat de helevacio de la palpebra, quar aquo ja es diversificat en les homes, quar de aquels es le quals indigeys que sia inscidit de la palpebra gran quantitat segon la quantitat per la qual la palpebra es mollificada.	Moreover, I must note that the figure should be according to the amount of swelling of the eyelid, for this already varies in women, for those in whom a large quantity of fluid has caused the eyelid to become soft.
E aprop fen am le spatum sobre las doas linhas las quals has senhadas, e comensa del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal menor.	And then apply the aqueous humor along the two lines you have marked, and start from the major lacrimal gland into the minor lacrimal gland.
E si’ la tua fissura prop dels pels naturals ayssi cum es la grossetut del rey.	And if your incision near the natural skin is as thick as the king's thumb.
E aprop met le onci en un dels dos angles de la codena, e aprop excoria aquela tota, e aprop ajusta am la scitura las doas labias am gula o fiel de lana subtil, e abstergeys le sanc, e fay adherir aquo que superflueys dels fiels sobre dos sobrecils am alcunas causas enviscans, si voles far aquo, e sino, non cures.	And then place the needle in one of the angles of the incision, and then scrape it completely, and then suture the two edges with a needle or thread of fine wool, and clean the wound, and adhere what remains from the threads on two small pieces of cloth for some viscous causes. If you want to do this, and if not, you do not need to.
E aprop leyssa la sutura dels fiels entro a tres dias o quatre, e aprop cura aquo.	And after that, let the stitching of the wounds be left between three days or four, and then cure this.
E si vols, layssa la plagua ses sutura, e cura aquela am aquo que exsicca e constrenh, quar la palpebra es alevada deves la sigillacio de la plagua e la agreguacio de lu; mays sutura es milor E donc aysso diysso les antics de taxanir.	And if you wish, leave the wound open without stitching, and cure it by promoting its drying and contraction, for when the eyelid is lifted, you should apply the sealing of the wound and its addition; more stitching is better. Therefore, thus say the ancient surgeons.
Mays empero en lu sia sollicitut sobre le malaute, e es de bona operacio, e no es en lu temor.	More importantly, the patient should be active in the treatment, and it is of good operation, and not out of fear.
E es autra manieyra en taxmir, e es que senhes sobre la palpebra figura ayssi cum fuelha de mirt, e aprop eleva la palpebra am tres uncis segreguatz e congreguatz segon aquesta forma:	And another method of treating it is to sew over the eyelid in the shape of a laurel leaf, and then lift the eyelid by about three inches, arranging and gathering it according to this form:
Mays si no es possible aquo, tener les uncis, e aquo no es engualhat, lahoras pren una agula en la qual haia fil e met aquela en le mieg de la figura, e entromet le autre fiel prop le lacrimal major, e·l fiel segon prop le lacrimal mendre, e ajusta entre les tieus ditz les fiels am equalitat, e aprop am aquels eleva la tua ma am elevacio engual, eleva tota la codena sobre la qual es senhat ayssi cum havem recomtat.	More importantly, if this is not possible, hold the needles, and as this is not feasible, then take a needle on which you have thread and put that in the middle of the figure, and insert the other thread near the major lacrimal gland, and the other thread near the minor lacrimal gland. Adjust the threads between the ties so they are equal, and then lift your hand for elevation equally, lifting the entire area over which it was sewn as we have advised.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then adjust the two edges of the wound with stitches, and cure what is inside until it is healed.
Mays si accideys apostema deves la tua inscizio o la tua fissura, seda aquel apostema am cerot e a lu semblantz, e am enguentz.	And if you make an incision or a fissure, stitch that abscess with thread and match its appearance, and apply ointment to it.
E alcunas veguadas endeve a la palpebra que·ls sieus pels sian convertitz, adonc cove que tu uses en aquela de aquo que havem dit de inscizio; mays sutura en quascus es mays artificial.	And sometimes on the eyelid, let its edges be converted, then use the incision that we have said and stitch those places more artificially.
Ataxinir am cannas es segon aquesta forma:	To cauterize with cantharides is done in this manner:
e es que tu convertas la palpebra e scindas la figura qu’es dedintz segon que he recontat; e aprop per art fay doas cannas o doas astelas subtils de las quals longitut sia segon la longitut de la palpebra e la latitut de lor sia mendra de la latitut del spatum.	And you convert the eyelid and split the figure that is inside according to what I have recounted; then, with art, make two cantharides or two thin sticks whose length be according to the length of the eyelid and their width a third of the width of the space.
E tu ja has inscidit en las extremitatz de quascunas partidas, la on tenes les fils.	And you have incised at the extremities of some parts, where you have the threads.
Aprop agregua quascuna am subtilitat subre aquo que superflueys de la palpebra del huel, e constres las cannas de quascunas partidas am fort strictura, e layssa aquela per alcus jorns, quar la codena per la strictura morira e sira denegada e se poyrira entro que per si meteyssa cayra.	Then apply a thin layer over what you have excised from the eyelid, and tightly bind the cantharides of each part, and leave it for a few days; as the constriction due to tight binding will cause death and necrosis, and it will fall off on its own.
Mays si es tardat, lahoras trenca la am las toroyras, e aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanat.	And if it is delayed, then cut the threads, and promptly cure the wound while it is healing.
Donc cum es solidada, la palpebra es elevada e les pels no pungo.	Therefore, when it is solidified, the eyelid is raised and the skin is not pricked.
E aquesta es la forma de doas cannas las quals faras segon aquesta forma:	And this is the form of two canes which you will make according to this form:
e haia la quantitat de la longitut e de la latitut ni mays ni mens.	and has neither more nor less in the length and width.
Capitol .xii.	Capitol.xii.
De elevacio de pels pungentz en le huel am agula quan le pel es dur.	For the elevation of painful skin flaps on the wound use an awl when the skin is tense.
Quan son pels no-naturals, durs e aspres e pungentz les huels, lahoras la operacio en lu es que tu prenguas agula subtil e pauses en aquela fiel de ceda subtil e leon, e aprop que tu ajustes las extremitatz de lu e nozes quascu en manieyra mot subtil.	When they are unnatural, hard, rough, and painful skins or flaps on the wound, for the operation there you should take a fine awl and place it in that fine fiber of ceda (a type of tree) and then adjust the ends of the fiber very subtly with small clamps in a delicate manner.
E sia la longitut dels fiels de quantitat de una palma.	And the length of the fibers should be the width of one palm.
E aprop tu compon2 autre fiel subtil dejos lu en breu, e nuza las extremitatz de aquel si tu·t vols.	And then you prepare another fine substance let it be brief, and use its extremities if you want.
E aprop pause le malaute le sieu cap en le tieu se, e sia prop del solelh per que la tua obra sia declarada, quar es operacio subtil e menuda.	And then place the patient's head in a slight tilt, and expose it to the sun so that your work is declared, for it is a subtle and delicate operation.
E aprop intromet la agulha en la razit del pel ajustat la qual ha necessitat de engen, e fay aquela penetrar en la palpebra festinantment entro que extraguas aquela desus le pel natural.	And then insert the needle into the incision of the eyelid, adjusting it with a device as needed, and let that penetrate deeply into the eyelid between the time you withdraw it from the natural skin.
E aprop tire le pel entro desus e intromet aquel en alixati, e sian les pels un o dos o tres e no mays.	And then pull the skin up and insert that into the incision, with the skin being one or two or three layers and no more.
E aprop tira la tua ma am aquel entro que·l pel sia fora-gitat am alixolati en la palpebra am le pel natural.	And then pull your hand there until the skin is relaxed in the incision on the eyelid with the natural skin.
Mays si es atirat alixalati e non es gitat le pel, atiraras alixati a las partidas dejos am le fiel le qual tu has compost am aquela, entro qu’en sia gitat alixalati del trau sobira.	But if the incision is made with an alexative and the skin is not relaxed, pull the alexative to the edges leaving it on the flesh where in it will be relaxed from the wound.
E vegas aquela am la visio del huel, quar lahoras tu gitaras alixati e lo fiel, e grotan quascu e clautz le huel, e laysse le claus per dos dias o tres, entro que·l pel adheresca al sieu loc e nasque sobre aquel bona carn.	And then in that place where you see the wound, there you will stitch the flesh, and sew each part tightly, and leave the stitches for two or three days, until the hair adheres to its place and grows over it good flesh.
E si es mays breu le pel, lahoras tu ajusta un pel lonc dels pels naturals, e es elevat am aquel, o que·l leysses entro que sia alonguat aprop alcu spazi, e lehoras tu eleva aquel.	And if the hair is shorter, there you adjust a longer piece of natural hair, and elevate it at that place, or let it grow over some space, and then you elevate that.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
De la cura de ehacratir la qual ve en la palpebra desus.	Of the cure for herniation which occurs in the upper eyelid.
Quan ve en le huel ehacratir, e es contraccio de la palpebra quan es contrayta en sus, o a dextra o a sinistra partida, per mala consolidacio de plagua o de seccio o de cauteri, e es apelada leporina, e aquesta ahercrati o es natural o accidental, e es fayta per consolidacio de plagua o de seccios o de cauteri, o per semblantz a lor malcuratz.	When there is herniation of the flesh, and it is a contraction of the eyelid that contracts towards the right or left side due to poor healing of a wound or section or cautery, it is called leporine. This herniation can be natural or accidental, caused by the consolidation of a wound or sections or cauteries, or resembling them in its malformation.
May la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que tu fendas aquela consolidacio e que separes las labias de lu, e pauses en lu en aquo que es entre aquelas una meca de drap de li, e ligues aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	For the method of the operation, you should cut the consolidation and separate the eyelid margins. Place there a strip of linen between them, and tie those together until they heal.
E no cove que tu uses de curacio de lu de las causas las quals exsiccan, constrenho; quar si tu fas aquo retorna alixacratir pus mal que nulh temps no foc habantz.	And know that you should use the cure for those causes which dry up and constrict; for if you do this it will return worse than ever without any time to heal.
Usa en aquela de causas que mollifico ayssi cum es fenugrec, e embroca am la aygua en la qual son coytz altea e semensa de li, o enguent dyaquilon, le qual sia liquefayt am alcu dels olis, e submergeys en aquel la meca, e cura am aquel.	Use for those causes that mollify thus as with fenugreek, and apply to the affected area in water in which they are soaked and seed of flax, or ointment of lard, which be liquefied by some of the oils, and immerse the medicament in that, and cure with that.
E lo tesaur de la tua curacio es que tu perforsses am tot engen que no sia consolidat segon la forma que foc al comensament.	And the treasure of your cure is that you perforate with anything not consolidated according to the form that it was at the beginning.
E aquesta operacio la qual havem dita, no es sino alcuna rectificacio de ehalixacrati que no retorna la forma del loc segon que foc denant.	And this operation which we have said is nothing but some correction of hernias that do not return to the form of the area as they were before.
Capitol .xiiii.	Capitol.xiv.
De la cura de ehacrati le qual es fayt en la palpebra dejos.	Of the cure of hernias which is done in the eyelid.
Aquesta alxacrati la qual es fayta en la palpebra dejos, la qual es nompnada vertadierament alxacrati; e es de lu alcuna natural, autra accidental.	This hernia which is done in the eyelid, which is named vertdiary hernia; and it can be either natural or accidental.
Mays accidental es fayta per plagua o per scissura o per cauteri o per autres semblantz.	More accidentally it is caused by a wound or a cut or a cautery or other similar causes.
E la via de la operacio de lu es que tu prenguas una agula en la qual haga fil doble, e fiques aquela en la carn, e que la fassas passar del lacrimal de senestre entro al lacrimal dextre, entro que·l fil pervengua en las doas extremitatz de la carn.	And the way of operating on it is that you take a needle on which you make double thread, and place that in the flesh, and make it pass from the left lacrimal to the right lacrimal, so that the thread reaches the two ends of the flesh.
E aprop exten la carn a las partidas desus am la agula e cus aquela am la agula, e inscideys am spatum ample.	Then extend the flesh at the upper parts with the needle and stitch it with the needle, and incise with a broad blade.
E donc si retorne la figura de la palpebre segon que cove, bo es; e sino, pren le ray e pausa aquel en la figura fenduda, e am aquel converteys la palpebra, e fen las doas fissuras en le latz de la palpebra dejos.	And therefore, if you return the shape of the eyelid as it should be, that is good; otherwise, take the ray and place it in the shape split, and with it convert the eyelid, and make the two fissures in the edge of the eyelid.
E sian las extremitatz de las doas fissuras de dos angles de la inscizio, la qual has fayta entro que concurren, e sia de lor fayt angle entro que quan se congreguan sia fayta figura de lor.	And let the ends of the two fissures be at two angles of the incision, which you have made where they converge, and form an angle between them so that when they meet, they form the shape of the eyelid.
E aquesta figura es letra greca: la landa.	And this figure is Greek letters: the lambda.
E aprop osta la carn aquela per la quantitat que es le latz de lu agut dejos de lu, aquo que siec la palpebra.	And then hold the flesh there according to the depth of the wound left by the sharp object, what we call the fleshy edge.
E aprop ajusta las partz seperadas e cos aquelas am le fil de lana; e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit de las medicinas mollificativas e de las calguas entro que sia sanat.	And then adjust the separated parts and close them with threads of wool; and then treat them with the medicines we have mentioned for softening and the plasters until they are healed.
E si alxacrati endeve per fissura o sutura o cauteri, lahoras cove que tu fendas am fissura plana sobre les pels de la palpebra segon que es precedit.	And if you suture or cauterize, then make a flat incision on the skin of the eyelid as previously described.
E aprop separa am la calgua entre doas labias segon que havem dit.	And then separate with the plaster between two lips as we have said.
En la suma del sermo de la cura de alxacrati quan es desus o dejos, que corra en lu operacio, segon que es preparat de la forma de alxacrati, e aquela es en forma de motas diversitatz.	In the conclusion of the discourse on the cure of suture when it is above or left over, let it run in the operation according to how it is prepared in the form of a suture, and that is in the form of various specks.
E le artifexs savi totz temps prepara engen en quascuna manieyra la qual es possibla a lu entro que fassa retornar la figura a la forma natural, o prop de aquela, e aquel malaute segon que a lu conveneys de la operacio e dels strumentz en las majors disposicios.	And the wise artisans at all times prepare ingeniously in any manner that is possible for them to return the figure to its natural form, or as close to it as possible, and the patient according to their convenience from the operation and the instruments in major dispositions.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.
De la adherencia de la palpebra am la conjunctiva o am la cornea.	Of the adhesion of the eyelid to the conjunctiva or to the cornea.
Quan accideys aquesta consolidacio a motz homes enayssi que sia solidada la palpebra pus desus am le album del huel, e sia prohibida de la facilitat del movement e de las suas obras naturals, donc cove que tu entrometas la extramitat del ray dejos la palpebra, e eleva en sus aquela, o exten aquela am le unci.	When this consolidation occurs in men, they attempt to secure the eyelid above by fixing it to the tarsus, and prohibit its ease of movement and its natural functions. Therefore, you should introduce a needle through the eyelid margin, let the eyelid, and elevate or extend it over the eye.
E aprop tu inscideys la adherencia am spatum subtil, le qual no sia am acuitat de las inscisios, habantz obtus un petit per so que·l malaute no sia inquietat deves la operacio, e remau le spatum que no ledesca le huel am la sua acuitat.	And then you incise the adhesion with a thin spatula, which should not be too sharp, having a small obtuse edge so that the patient is not disturbed by the operation, and remove the spatula without damaging the eye.
E sia la tua inscizio quays excorjan aquela adherencia am facilitat entro que sia retornada la palpebra segon la sua forma natural e que sia sanada tota la adherencia.	And let your incision excise the adhesion with ease, so that the eyelid returns to its natural form and all the adhesion is healed.
E aprop tu met en le huel aygua salada am la qual tu laves; o distilla en lu de zunia dissolvut en l’aygua.	And then put salt water into the eye and wash with it; or use distilled water in which zinc has been dissolved.
E aprop separa entre la palpebra e l’huel am calgua de li, e pausa sobre le huel lana infuza en album de huou, e aprop le tertz jorn usa de causas consolidativas entro que sia sanat.	And then separate between the eyelid and the sore of the eye, and place over the sore infused wool in honey album, and during the third day use conservative causes until it is healed.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De inscizio de ungla e de eminencia de carn dels lacrimals.	On the incision of the eyelid and the prominence of flesh of the lacrimal bone.
Sapias que ungla es segon dos manieyras, quar o es nervosa, e es semblant a ciphac dur subtil; o es no-nervosa, semblant a humiditat blanca congilada, la qual quan ferr la toca, o es forsat aquela prendre am onci, es abscindida e le onci no es ficat en lu.	Know that the eyelid is of two kinds: one is nervous, resembling a thin hard cord; the other is non-nervous, resembling white congealed moisture. When you touch it, if it must be cut, it is divided, and the substance does not enter it.
E amdos las specias no comensan sino del lacrimal major entro que va petit a petit que cobre la vista e prohibeys le lum e·l movement de huel.	And both species do not begin but from the major lacrimal bone, which gradually covers the eye and prevents both light and movement of the eye.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en la inscizio de lu es que·l malaute pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop obre les huels de lu, e eleva la palpebra am la tua ma, e aprop colligeys la ungla am onci de pauca duplicacio e exten aquela a las partidas desus.	The way to act in the incision of the eyelid is that the patient places his head in a slight tilt, then opens the eyes and raises the eyelid with your hand. Then collect the eyelid substance with little duplication and extend it to the upper parts.
E aprop pren una agula e entromet en aquela un pel de cavalh o de buou o de vaqua, o de semblantz, o de fiel fort, o duplica la extremitat de la agulha petit a petit e fica aquela en le mieg de la ungla, e penetra aquela am la agulha, e lia am fiel la ungla; e exten aquela a las partidas desus, e excorja am le pel le latz de la ungla lo qual siec la pupilla.	And then take a needle and insert in it a hair of horse or bull or cow, or of similar, or of strong thread, or gradually double the end of the needle little by little and place that in the middle of the nail, and penetrate that with the needle, and seal the nail with glue; and extend that to the upper parts, and strip the skin of the nail which heals the pupil.
E ayssi tu sieguas aquela am le pel entro al derier de lu.	And then you follow that with the hair into the heel of it.
E aprop tu inscideys le romanent en la razitz del lacrimal am spatum subtil o am petitas forfexs, e leysa la carn del lacrimal natural per so que per inscizio de aquela no endevengua fluxs de lagremas continuabla.	And then you incise the raw flesh in the rim of the eyelid with a fine spatum or small forceps, and let the natural flesh of the eyelid remain so that by this incision it will not develop continuous flow of tears.
E alscunas vetz la ungla am le sol onci estenduda o am fiel, ayssi co havem dit, e aprop sia excurjat am spatum leon del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And sometimes the nail on the sole of the foot or with glue, as we have said, and then strip it with a lion's spatum, which is the form of that:
E guarda te que am le spatum no toques la tunica cornea e que avengua en lu ruptura, e que la pupilla sia perforada.	And be careful that with the spatum you do not touch the corneal membrane, and even if there is a rupture in it, and that the pupil is not punctured.
Aprop la inscizio geta en le huel un pauc de sal trissa o di cief fayt de siniar, e leyssa aquel entro al autre dia; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	Near the incision make a small cut in the skin with a needle or knife made of steel, and leave that there for a day; then take care that which comes between it is healed.
E si la ungla no es nervoza e no podes metre la agulha, ni es ficada en aquela le onci, lahoras motas veguadas aquesta specia de ungla es curada am medicinas, e es sanada ayssi cum yeu e recomtat en la divisio.	And if the wound is not nervous and you cannot put the needle there, then moisten this kind of wound with medicines, and it will be healed in this way as described in the division.
E si tu vols inscindir aquela, lahoras tu obre le huel del malaute e pren spatum subtil leon de freul acuitat segon aquesta forma:	And if you want to incise it, then open the wound of the patient and take fine powder of burnt frankincense according to this form:
am subtilitat.	with fine subtlety.
E si vezes que aquela es rarificada e es confugida e empren en aquela razit, lahoras distilla de la tua ora en le huel de cief fayt de siniar o am cief rog o am sal trissat, e opila le huel entro a l’autre dia.	And if you see that it is rarified and condensed and impregnated in that space, then blow from your mouth into the wound made of steel or with cloth soaked in frankincense or salt, and plug the wound with another piece.
E aprop itera sobre aquela la operacio entro que sia remaugut tot aquo que es de lu, sino que·l contrari apostema caut sia en le huel, quar lahoras tu leyssa aquela, e cura al comensament la apostema entro que sia sanat.	Then repeatedly perform the operation until everything from it is removed, otherwise if a suppuration occurs in the wound, then you leave it, and cure the beginning of the suppuration until it is healed.
E aprop itera la tua operacio sobre aquela am razo entro que sia sanat.	And then iterate your operation over that area until it is healed.
La emenencia de la carn lacrimal, si notz en le huel per gran nocument, sia suspendut am onci; e inscideys aquela de aquela una partida, e no ultimes la inscizio per so que no inscidesqua fluxs de lagremas.	The eminence of the tear duct, if noted for great injury, should be suspended with an ounce; and incise part of that, and do not complete the incision so that it does not cut off the flow of tears.
E aprop distilla en le lacrimal cief rog e fayt de siniar entro que sia sanat.	And then let the tear duct heal and keep it open until it is healed.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De inscizio de alguazardenic e de aquo que es nascut de carn ajustada en le huel.	On the incision of algazardenic and what arises from flesh attached to the wound.
Alcunas veguadas en les huels de alcus es nascuda carn roga, e es sobre-pausada entro que cobre la pupilla, o apropinqua o estrenh sobre las palpebras e fort leu comprem las palpebras a las partidas deforo e es assemblada a roza de balaustra.	In some wounds of the eye, new flesh grows and is pressed over the pupil, or comes close to or strengthens the eyelids, lifting them from the parts outside and adheres to the edge of the orbit.
Mays la operacio en lu es que·l malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se; e aprop obre les huels de aquel e colligeys tota aquela carn am oncis convenientz ad aquo, e te aquo am una forcep o am cesti; e aprop inscindiys la carn el comensament entro que tot sia finit am le encisori, e guarda te del huel que no ledescas aquel deves la tua operacio.	More importantly, the operation is that the patient places their head in a tilted position; then open the wounds and collect all that flesh with appropriate incisions using forceps or tongs; and continue to incise the flesh until everything is finished with the scissors, and carefully keep the wound so as not to lose any part of your operation.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscides aquelas o am espatum le qual nos havem recomtat en la inscizio de la ungla, o am petitas forfexs am las quals es colligit ascebel segon que vindra la forma de lu aprop aquest capitol. So when your incision is completed and the entire flesh is cauterized, then fill the wound with salted honey, or sprinkle it with powdered substances resembling those of corrosive medicines, and place something over the wound externally like a plaster until an abscess is assured.

Mays empero tu cove que alienes tota curacio del huel freul per via natural o per via accidental, obran am ferr, e no metas la tua ma en alcuna de aquestas operacios entro que veges que aquel membre sia suffertant aquela operacio.	Yet, however, you must ensure that all healing of the wound by natural means or by accidental means is allowed to proceed, using iron, and do not place your hand in any of these operations until you see that that limb is suffering from that operation.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De colleccio de sabel en le huel.	From the collection of knowledge in the whole.
Sabel so venas rogas las quals son testudas sobre le huel e prohibeysso al vesement la sua operacio, e develican le huel am longitut de dias.	Knowledge pertains to veins that are swollen in the whole and you prohibit their operation, and they expand the whole for a length of days.
Donc necessari es al comensament que tu consideres si le huel en le qual es sabel es fort e en lu no es autra malautia que sabel, lahoras tu colligeys aquel sabel.	Therefore, at the beginning, you must consider whether the pain in which knowledge pertains is strong and if there is no other disease present that causes pain, then you collect that knowledge.
E es que tu comandes al malaute que pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop suspen aquelas venas am un onci o am dos segon la tua prudencia; e sia aquel onci de subtil duplicacio segon aquesta forma:	And you must command the patient to place his head in a tub of water, and then suspend those veins at one or two inches according to your discretion; and let that inch be of subtle double thickness according to this form.
o so dos oncis gradantment en un cos segon aquesta forma:	or be two inches gradually in one piece according to this form.
E aprop sian colligidas aquelas venas am forses subtils, am subtilitat, e abstergeys le sanc hora aprop hora, entro que vegas aquelas venas esser remaugudas del huel e sian revolgudas.	And let those veins be collected with strong subtlety, in subtlety, and cleanse the ulcer hour by hour, while you observe that those veins are drawn from the whole and are reversed.
E guarda te que tu no ledes le huel am las extremitatz del spatum; e si’ la tua operacio en le miegjorn denant le solelh, e sias mot ferm en la tua operacio que no inscidas sino aquelas venas.	And guard thee that thou lead not the wound at the extremities of the spine; and if thy operation in midday before the sun, and be thou firm in thy operation that thou enter not save those veins.
E quan tu auras complitz, lahoras tu distilla en le huel cief vert o rog per que am sa acuitat corrodesca aquo que es remaugut del sabel.	And when you have completed, then thou distill in the wound vinegar or rue to cause what is rehumidified by the bile to dry.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible colligeys tot en aquela hora, e lahoras tu emplastra tot am aquo que cede la dolor de lu, e leyssa lu per alcus dias entro que sia sedada la dolor de lu e que sia asegurat de apostema caut.	But if this is not possible for thee in that hour, then thou plaster all with what yields relief to it, and let it be for a few days until the pain is subdued and an abscess secured.
E aprop itera sobre lu segon que la mateyssa manieyra entro que sia sanat.	And repeatedly work over it according to how the wound behaves until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de las forfexs:	And this is the method for fistulae:

De reduccio de arizati al nas.	On the reduction of deviations in the nose.
Quan tu curas arisati am cauteri o am medicina aguda comburent segon que es precedida la narracio de lu e no es sanat, lahoras no es engen en lu sino que fendas sobre le apostema deves la maturitat de lu, e que extraguas tota la humiditat la qual es en lu e·l poyre entro que sia descubert le os.	When you treat deviations in the nose with a cautery or with sharp burning medicine according to the narration of it and it does not heal, then do not engage in it but rather cut over the abscess to bring about its maturity, and extract all the humidity which is within it and let the pus be discharged from the bone.
E donc cum es descubert le os e vezes en lu corrupcio o negror, lahoras tu ratz lu am un sturment del qual aquesta es la forma:	And when the bone and veins within it are corrupted and blackened, then you treat it with an instrument of which this is the form:
E es nompnat de aspre cap, e sia feyt de fer indi, e sia le cap redon ayssi cum asir le qual sia fayt punctat per punctacio de lima o aliskalfati per punctacio subtil (ayssi cum es en la forma seguent).	And it is called a sharp knife, and it is made of iron, and its head is round, much like the handle of which it is made punctuated by the teeth of an awl or finely engraved by punctation (as in the form following).
E pausa aquel sobre le loc corrumput del os, e aprop revolveys aquel entre les tieus ditz, e prem la tua ma petit a petit entro que sapias que aquela corropcio es rasa.	And place it over the corrupted part of the bone, and then rotate it between the pincers, and press your hand gradually into the area until you know that the corruption is superficial.
E aquo sia fayt alcunas veguadas, e aprop restaura le loc am causas exsiccativas e stipticas.	And do this several times, and then restore the area caused by drying and constrictive treatments.
Donc si·l loc es consolidat e es en lu nascuda bona carn e es abscindit le cors de la sania e roman per xl dias, e no es renovat e no es apostemat e no accideys en lu accident, lahoras tu sapias que es sanat.	Then if the area is consolidated and there is good flesh hidden within and the wound is divided from the healthy tissue for 40 days, and it is not reinfected and does not become gangrenous and no accident occurs, then you know that it is healed.
E sino, lahoras no es en lu engen sino reduzir la fissura a la forma del nas, e segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu descuebras de segon os am ferr o am medicina acuta, e cum sira descubert le os, lahoras tu pren tribo segon aquesta forma:	And if not, then reduce the fracture to the shape of the nose, and according to this manner: you uncover the bone with iron or sharp medical instruments, and as the bone is uncovered, you take hold according to this form.
Sia la extramitat de lu ferr triangulada, e·l fust de lu sia prim extenuat entro a la extremitat ayssi cum vezes assi.	Let the end of the tool be triangular, and let the stem be thickened at the extremity in such a manner as you see.
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le os, e sia aquel prop del lacrimal; e alongua la tua ma un pauc del huel, e aprop revol la tua ma am le tribo entro que penetre tot le os, e aquel sente le malaute per asso que atroba vent yssir per so quan te la sua ma.	And then place that [tool] on the bone, and let it be close to the lacrimal; extend your hand a little further, and then rotate your hand in the groove until the entire bone is penetrated, and that which feels the malady perceives air issuing from it when you place your hand there.
Donc lahoras restaura le loc am medicinas stipticas exsiccantz ayssi cum t’e eyssenhat.	Then restore the place with medicinal astringents that dry up in the manner you have seen.
Donc cum nays la carn e·l loc es endurazit, lahoras la materia la qual effundia a las partidas deforo retorna al nas, donc aquo es pus leugier sobre le malaute.	Then, when the flesh has dried and the place has become hardened, the matter which it was exuding to the exterior returns to its normal state, thus this is lighter for the malady.
Capitol .xx.	Capitol.xx.
De reduccio de la eminencia del huel.	On the reduction of the prominence of the heel.
Quan le huel emineys am la sua totalitat e no accideys en le vezement nocument ni diminuacio, lahoras cove que laxas le malaute, e aprop que·l segues, e aprop que pausas ventozas en le cervitz ses scarificacio e succa per bona succaccio; e aprop pausa sobre le huel liniment le qual sia fayt de acatra e aloe e enses e sarcocolla, e aprop strenh le emplaustre sobre le huel am motz polvils.	When the heel swells completely and there is no damage or diminution of the skin, then you should release the malady, and soon after, apply hot fomentations to the neck for six scarifications and draining; then place liniment on the heel made from acacia, aloe, garlic, and dragon's blood, and firmly apply the plaster to the heel with powder.
E la manieyra dels polvils es que prenguas draps de li leons motz, e quascun drap sia duplicat en quatre plecs; e fay de aquels motz.	And the manner of powders is that you take cloths from the lion's tail, and each cloth be folded into four parts; and make of those tails.
E aprop pausa aquels la un sobre le autre segon la quantitat de la qual ha le huel necessitat.	And then place them one over the other according to the quantity that it has to be used.
E aprop strenh sobre aquels am drap dur am fort strictura; e itera las ventosas am succio ses scarificacio; e aprop osta las ventosas e leyssa le huel streyt le dia e la nueyt.	And then tightly bind them with a firm cloth; and repeatedly apply the suction cups with several incisions; and then place the suction cups and keep them tight for the day and night.
Mays si entretant le liguament es mollificat, lahoras cove que sia mot streyt.	But if meantime the ligature becomes softened, then keep it tightly fastened.
E aprop osta le liament aprop le dia e la nueyt ayssi cum havem dit.	And then keep the ligature tight for the day and night as we have said.
E si vezes le huel ja esser redusit, bo es, e sino, lahoras itera le emplastre am les polvils e la strictura e las ventosas entro que sia sanat.	And if the swelling has already been reduced, that is good. Otherwise, then repeatedly apply the plaster with the powders and the binding and suction cups until it is healed.

De la inscizio de la eminencia de la tunica uvea.	On the incision of the prominence of the uveal tunic.
Quan endeve disrupcio en la tunica uvea, e aprop es eminent e procezeys fora las palpebras ayssi cum un gra de rasim, e es orrazada la forma de home per aquo, e vols aquo inscidir, lahoras la operacio en lu es ayssi cum havem recomtat, que tu entrometas la agula en la razitz de la uvea de la partida dejos en la partida desus, e aprop met la agula autra en la qual sia fil doble de la part del lacrimal, e fay aquela penetrar e leyssa la primieyra agula segon la sua disposicio; e aprop inscideys le loc del fiel doble e leva am aquel la partida de la uvea en le circuit de la agula, e strenh aquela mot.	When there is disruption in the tunica uvea, and it is prominent, you must proceed to lift the eyelids as if with a degree of forceps, and this reveals the form of a man through this. If you wish to incise here, then the operation on it is as we have described, that you insert the needle into the cut of the uvea from one side to the other, and then place another needle in the part of the lacrimal gland which is double, and make the latter penetrate while leaving the first needle in its position; then incise the location of the double filament and lift the part of the uvea in a circle around the needle, and strengthen that movement.
E aprop extratz la agula e pausa sobre le huel lana infusa en album de huou e leyssa entro que cayha le fil am la uva.	Then remove the needle and place it over the heated wool infused with honey, letting the filament dry in the uvea.
E aprop cura le huel am aquo que conforte aquel entro que la plagua sia sanada.	Then apply heat to this to comfort it while the wound is healing.
E alcunas veguadas aduna de tota partida am cercle de drap entro le huel ajuste eminencia gran, e aprop sia perforat am le spatum subtil que vengua al preon del huel, e corra la humiditat albuginea, e descen le huel e intra tantost.	Sometimes gather all the parts in a circle of cloth over the heat, adjust the prominence greatly, then perforate with a fine needle that comes from below the heat, allowing the humectant humor to flow, lowering the heat and inserting it soon.
E aprop strenh entro que sia sanat.	And then strengthen as it is healed.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.
De curacio de alconati.	On the cure of ulcers.
Aquesta malautia que es apelada alconati no es sino sania la qual es ajustada en le huel semblant a aygua dessendent e no es aquela.	This illness called an ulcer is nothing but a wound that appears similar to water flowing down and is not the other type.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en ela es que fasses le malaute sezer sobre la sela aparelada e dreyta, e aprop pren le cap sieu en las tuas mas de doas partz e mau aquel entro que veias la sania pervenir a las partidas dejos, e aprop sia siccada e no descenda, e sia ostat le lum, e·l malaute veia las causas ayssi cum vezia.	The method of treating it is to place the patient on a prepared and straight bench, then take the head in your hands at two parts and carefully bring it where you see the ulcer approaching the extremities, ensuring it dries up and does not descend, and keep the light nearby, so that the patient can see the causes as if seeing them.
E si no descendra en jos, sapias que es aygua.	And if it does not descend to the feet, you know that it is water.
Mays si no es preparat le descendement a la sania am aquo que havem dit, lahoras fay le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e aprop pren spatum subtil e fen am aquel sobre le pannicol cernent un petit deves la continuacio de la conjunctiva am la tunica cornea en la corona (entro al loc vuet), entro que sia fora-getada la sania.	And if the descent of the ulcer is not prepared as we have said, then place the patient's head between your hands and, closely, take a thin spatula and apply it to the gauze, sprinkling a little over the continuation of the conjunctiva onto the cornea (in the area marked), so that the ulcer dries up.
Donc cum es fora-getada, lahoras tu distilla en le huel aygua cauda en la qual has mesclat mel o aygua en la qual ja has bulit fenugrec e mel.	Then, as it is forgotten, when you distill into the vessel of water in which you have mixed honey or water in which you have already steeped fenugreek and honey.
E aprop sia curat am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the other causes until it is cured.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De la curacio de la aygua descendent del huel.	On the treatment of water descending from above.
Ja havem dit las specias de la aygua en la divisio e qual conveneys a perforar am sermo declarant, lahoras aquel segon la sanetat.	We have already mentioned the species of water in the division and which is appropriate to puncture as we declared, and then proceed according to its health.
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre un cayrat e lia le sieu huel sa, lu mot stringent.	Then you must place the patient's legs on a bench and tie his feet to it securely.
