E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col e aprop te le sieu nas am la tua ma sinistra, e pren le fleubotomi subtil lonc e fica aquela en le mieg loc del cap del nas segon rectitut, quar la vena no appar al sentiment aqui, e quar le sanc comensa a fluir tantost.	And the quality of the femoral puncture is that the patient clenches his teeth and holds his nose with your left hand, and perform the femoral puncture with a thin long needle in the middle of the nasal cavity according to the correct location, for the vein does not appear here by sensation, and the bleeding starts soon.

Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de las doas guidegui a constriccio de ale e a comensament de lepra e a motas malautias e inpetige e malas ulceracios corrosivas ayssi cum herpotromeno.	And the indication for the femoral puncture is to treat arthritis, leprosy, and other chronic ailments and corrosive ulcers similarly to phlebotomy.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela. E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.	And the benefit of the femoral incision on the algirich veins, it helps to discharge small abscesses and pustules from the mouth and corruption of the gums and bad ulcers and fissures, and bad ulcers that are in the nose and around it.

And the quality of the femoral incision is that you make the patient lie down before you, and strengthen his neck with a bandage, and then turn the lips and look at two veins, one from the right side of the lip and the second from the left; the demonstration of each is by the blackness of each of both, and what is more, in the area around those are small black veins; then incise each through an incision.
Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas.	But if you are uncertain about which one it is, then you understand the incision of the larger one and the most obvious one among them.
E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.	And make the appearance of the two veins that are above the lips.
Mays costuma corr mays a inscidir las doas venas que so en la labia dejos.	But it is customarily better to incise the two veins that are in the lip.
Mays de doas venas que so dejos la lengua le juvament es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a prefocacios que so en le guolayro, a la malautia de la uvula, e a malautias de la boca.	But the treatment for the two veins that are below the tongue is close to the phlebotomy of the cephalic vein, especially those located in the glosse, for the illness of the uvula, and other illnesses of the mouth.

And the quality of phlebotomizing those veins is to follow the illness as it moves in front of your left side before the sun rises, elevate the tongue, and look at the tongue from both sides of its vein, noting that the color of each becomes gradually darker.
E adonc fleubotoma quascuna; e guarda te que no ultimes la tua ma en fleubotoman aquelas, quar dejos aquelas so arterias.	And then phlebotomize each one; be sure not to end your hand in phlebotomy of those, for they are arteries.
E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And your veins which are ligated in the groin are in them customarily found in all men, and the ligation of their veins is done according to two ways, or they put a ligature for ligation mirtilat or olive at subtlety declining; or dry with a surgical ligation, and call it alnessil, and this is its form:
E aquest alnessil es que conveneys a seccio e de aquels so specias latz e subtils segon la amplitut de las venas e segon la strictura de aquelas.	And this alnessil is that you apply to section and of those are species flax and subtle according to the width of the veins and according to the structure of those.
Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	Form of mirtilat ligation:
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	it is like the flax you see, and you apply to open the concave veins filled with prominent large arteries, and at those that contain thick turbid blood.
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	And this is the form of olive ligation:

Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	May the youth of the femoral incision of the basilic vein, which is one of three veins: for from it you extract the blood from the patient that you leave to drain the legs and the belly.
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	And it convenes to the phlebotomizer, when performing that phlebotomy, that he well guard it and be over-cautious in it, for if he leaves the artery there in the puncture of the phlebotomy, he will incise that artery and cause flows of blood, so that one must ensure not to phlebotomize at a phlebotomy puncture before sectioning with a needle.
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the basilic vein does not appear by obvious manifestation, then it convenes that you leave that and change to the other, or that you search for one of its branches; or that you phlebotomize in a location at the end of the arm, for that is manifest; and section the other vein with a needle as we have said.
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	May it be that you want the phlebotomy of the femoral vein, then in front of the stricture of the thigh, touch the location between where you know the pulse, and place your hand over it with pressure; then raise the thigh and section the vein with a concave incision as we have said; and guard that the percussion does not reach some space of the area of the artery.
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	And when you see, as you tighten the ligament, inflation occurs in the place that you have touched with your hand, then that inflation is artery inflation, and therefore avoid it.
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	And if you see the blood flow during phlebotomy as golden in children, and the blood is thin and clear, then you know it is arterial blood; then close and pause your hand for a long time over that place; and approach your hand there, and if the blood stops flowing, and four or five drops stop flowing, then you tighten your arm and let go of that.
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	And keep the patient from the moccio of it, and be over-fearful of it and do not wet that for a few days until it is healed.
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	And if the blood does not stop flowing, and you know that you should not be doing this without proper medical knowledge, then cut the artery if it appears to you; for its extremity will contract and the blood will stop flowing; or take some from a fistula, and do that, and take half of it and apply it strongly over the vein with stricture descent on the ligament and with powder the next day.
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	And if the wound is cut open, that is good; otherwise, treat that part as described previously in the place of the wounds where the flow of blood was stopped.
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	And the cutting open of the wound is difficult in many positions due to the small size of the wound and the possibility of limb movement.
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	More from the dark vein, phlebotomy is beneficial that you extract the blood from the part above the head and from the part below the body; for this, it is composed of a branch of the basilica vein and a branch of the cephalic vein, as we have said.
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	And when phlebotomizing the vein that is over-taxed in this phlebotomy, note that what you have left is a nerve; then if you adjust the puncture and find the nerve, it will cause stupor, and recovery from it is difficult. It is not easily cured completely. This nerve often appears with sensations; if hidden to some people and thin and not obvious, then pause your phlebotomy at the section of alnessil, and avoid the nerve with your forceps.
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	And if the vein is between two nerves, then you cut the vein lengthwise.
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	The purpose of the phlebotomy of the cephalic vein is to draw blood from the head and alleviate the ailments of the feet.
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	And here specifically, if you want the phlebotomy to be effective, use either an olive branch or a myrtle branch; for these are clean and free from all veins, and do not injure the artery or nerves.
Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.	But nevertheless, you should perform the phlebotomy carefully, ensuring that you do not puncture the head of the lizard solely, and choose a lighter location. Do not press on it, unless it is bruised by the first percussion before which you perform the phlebotomy several times.
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.	But nevertheless, an abscess is stronger in some people, when it is not phlebotomized in the first percussion; however, do not press on it again to treat the abscess.
Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.	But the quality of the phlebotomy of that and the accidents related to it are matters that you should consider in their correction.
Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	The first thing is that you must know that the bloodletting is not administered except for conservation of health and with hope for it and caution about the outcome of illnesses, and that the bloodletting be done in one of the veins that are in the armpit: namely, cephalic, basilic, and femoral; and that the bloodletting be done at the beginning of spring, on fasting in spring and autumn, and in winter around meals, when signs of repletion appear.
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.	And the bloodletting be done on the third day or at the first opportunity after three hours of the day have passed.
Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	More bloodletting that is administered, more when it provokes convenience and necessity at that time, whether night or day, in any hour and at all times.
E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans.	And know that an infant should not be bloodlet until it has reached four years, and a woman who is pregnant should not be bloodlet except in the fourth month between the seventh and eighth months, and old women should not be bloodlet which have passed fifty years.
E cum alcu vol esser fleubotomat per qualque manieyra sia, cove que mondifique les sieus budels denant la fleubotomia am clisteri leon, si en aquels ha mota fenda retenguda, per so que las venas no atiro las superfluitatz en la fleubotomia dels budels, que son puridas, e que no noguan als membres principals.	And when someone wishes to be lanced in some manner beforehand, make sure to modify his intestines before the lancing with a leon clister, if there is a mota fenixed retained, so that the veins do not eject the superfluous fluids during the lancing of the intestines, which are purged, and do not harm the principal members.
E no sian fleubotomatz les pascientz naucea sacertiva e crapula, ni evasent de malautia ni de ebretat entro que aquo sia remaugut aquo de lor, ni malaute de ydropici, e mays que fleubotomia sia temuda aprop colica passio e aprop vomit, e aprop cos de ventre, e aprop multiplicacio de coyt e de trebal e de exercici de dejunis o de vigilias e de tota causa que dissolveys la vertut, o sia corpore28 o animal.	And patients who are lanced do not suffer from nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea, nor evacuation of disease or intoxication until what is in them is evacuated, nor gout, but more importantly, lancing is feared before colic pain, before vomiting, before abdominal condition, before multiplication of coitus and labor and exercise before fasting or watching, and for all causes that dissolve the virtue, either corporeally or animal.
E aprop considera en subtiliacio de humos denant aquo si le sanc es gros, am viandas e beures, e am medicinas si aquo es a lu possible ad aquo.	And consider in the subtlety of humors before this if the wound is large, with food and drinks, and with medicines if this is possible at this time.
E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.	And consider bathing the wound if any cause does not prohibit it, or exercise due to some exercise so that the wound becomes subtle.
E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.	And pause the femoral incision at the foot of the bed, so around three o'clock, as we have said.
E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor.	And I assure you that the foot of that side should be guarded on the day of all evil accidents, as when it is distressed, anger, fear, and all bodily accidents, as when it is tired and excessive work or intercourse and similar to them.
E a la sua sezelha fassa esser presentz las causas en le us de la qual corr costuma dels homes am aromaticitat e odorament e am bals e semblantz ad aquels segon la cantitat de possibilitat.	And at her side, let the causes in the use of which custom has accustomed men with aromatics and perfumes and with balsams and similar according to the quantity and possibility be present.
E segua le fleubotomador sobre un coyssi que sia pus aut que·l coyssi de aquel que deu esser fleubotomat.	And follow the femoral incision over a cushion that is higher than the cushion on which the patient lies.
E aprop extragua le sieu bras, e fregue aquel am la sua ma le fleubotomador doas o tres veguadas; e aprop strenha le liament am correia e involva aquel doas veguadas.	Then withdraw his leg, and rub it with your hand the femoral incision two or three times; then tightly bind it with a strap and wrap it twice.
E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.	And let the stricture be tempered, for when the stricture is not equal, or when the stricture is due to excess, then prohibit the flow of blood; or when it is due to relaxation, then similarly control the body's flow of blood.
E aprop la strictura, cove que aquel que deu esser fleubotomat fregue las suas mas ensemps entre lor entro que las venas sian imfladas, e sian declaradas al sentiment.	And near the stricture, ensure that those who are to perform the ligation press their hands together between them where the veins are swollen and made clear by sensation.
E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.	And near the ligation, apply a little antiseptic oil to the site properly; then place your left hand index finger on the vein, positioning the location for the ligation so that the vein slightly protrudes and is easily felt. This is where you find the vein resembling a fleeing cord, which is full of venosity. When you press the ligation over this area, it contracts, revealing the location to the ligator; if the ligation does not take on the vein, but instead closes it off, that is good.
E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	And therefore, ensure that the ligator is firm and attentive to all these causes.
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.	And then place the ligature, but if the vein bursts in one go, that is good; otherwise, repeat this or the other loop, slightly securing the area, or apply a compress if the site does not show signs of suppuration.
Et si le loc es apostemat, o le malaute se spauresca, lahoras tu le layssa per un dia o per dos, e no strenha le liament, quar fort leu atirara apostema caut, ni no intre en banh.	And if the place is suppurated, or the wound becomes inflamed, then you let it be for one or two days, and do not tighten the bandage, for fear that it will produce a pus abscess or not heal.
E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.	And repeat the phlebotomy if necessary.
E si la apercio es petita e corr sanc subtilment, e temes que non yesca sanc la cantitat que voles, lahoras tu itera le fleubotomi en aquel trauc segon rectitut e ajusta en la appercio un pauc, e fay aquo am festinacio denant que·l loc sia apostemat, quar le loc es apostemat en motz homes deves pauca apercio.	And if the perception is small and the wound heals subtly, and you fear that it will not heal the amount you want, then repeat the phlebotomy in that vein according to correctness and adjust slightly to the perceived amount. Do this with hastiness before the place suppurates, for when the place suppurates, you should have little perception.
Mays si vezes aquel ja apostemat, lahoras no iteres sobre lu, quar no escusa a tu alcuna causa; e pausa sobre aquel alcuna partida de la fenda de oli, quar alleuja le cors del sanc.	But if you see that it already suppurates, then do not repeat it over it, for there is no cause to do so; instead, place it over a part of the wound where pus does not appear, which alleviates the body from the wound.
E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	And it is better in this place than oil and other oils.
E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.	And similarly administer the wound of oil in all phlebotomies where you have lanced the veins; they should prohibit the flow of blood from the body, and do this with tyriaca alfadoc and sagzenea when placed over the area, for the blood is thinned and circulated when it is thick.
E si en le loc de la fleubotomia es engendrat gran apostema, quar motas veguadas accideys, e majorment ad aquel que no es stat sangnat sino aquela veguada, o en la apercio de la vena pauca, e lahoras tu coyta, e pausa sobre le loc sponja infuza en aygua e sal, un pauc scalfada, e strenh aquela per una hora, quar es dissolvut.	And if in the place of the incision a large abscess is generated, many motile vesicles occur, especially to him who has not been bled at that time nor during the appearance of the small vein, then apply over the area a soaked sponge in water and salt, slightly warm, and keep it there for one hour, as it dissolves.
E cove que fassa aquo aprop le yssiment del sanc de aquela vena am compliment de lu o de autra vena.	And make sure to do this near the end of the bleeding from that vein with the aid of the other vein.
E si roman en le loc per alcus dias alcuna negror o viriditat, no notz aquo; e si voles, pausa sobre aquel alcuna causa de aloen e de mirra dissolvut, o alcuna causa de suc de mentastre o de calament o semblant de lu.	And if any blackness or greenish color remains in the area for several days, do not note this; if you wish, place over it some solution of aloes and myrrh, or some juice of mint or of camphor, or a similar substance.
E motas veguadas accideysso apostemas e eminencias deves fleubotomia de la basilica.	And many motile vesicles occur and abscesses form from the incision of the basilica.
E donc pausa la tua ma sobre aquela, e si lahoras tu atrobas mollicia deves la tua compressio sobre aquela, lahoras aquela eminencia es malvada e mala; e adonc guarda te que pauses sobre aquela alcuna causa de aquo que havem dit, quar fort leu fluira de la arteria sanc.	And place your hand over that area. If then you find it soft, apply your compress to that area, as that eminence is bad and harmful; then be careful to place over it some of what we have said, for strong blood will flow from the artery.
E fay emplaustre am aquo en que es stipticitat, per que le loc sia endurat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And apply a plaster to this where there is stiffness, so that the area may become hardened, and then treat it with the other treatment until it is healed.
E cove que extraguas del sanc a tot hom segon la quantitat de la sua vertut e segon la color vencent sobrc le sanc segon que appar.	And know that you should draw from the patient all according to the quantity of its virtue and according to the dominant color above the wound as it appears.
Quar si le sanc es negre, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia rog; e semblantment si tu le vezes gros, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia subtiliat; e semblantment si es agut, entro que sia ostada la acuitat de lu.	And if the blood is black, let it remain until it becomes clear; and similarly, if you see it thick, let it continue to flow until it becomes thin; and similarly, if it is acute, let it continue until its sharpness is reduced.
E cove ad aquel que es ple e fort e ha necessitat de extraccio de sanc en una veguada, que sia amplificada la fleubotomia de la vena e le fleubotomi sia lat.	And know that for one who is full and strong and has the need for a single bloodletting, the incision of the vein should be enlarged and the bleeding should be allowed.
E en aquel que es freul, sia fayt le contrari de aquel, e cove que extragua aquel en tropas veguadas, e que le trauc sia streyt.	And for one who is weak, do the opposite, and know that you should draw off in smaller quantities over several days, and that you should let it continue.
E le milhor que es administrat en fleubotomia de vena es que sia la seccio transversa, no punctura.	And the best that is administered in bloodletting from a vein is a transverse section, not a puncture.
E aquesta manieyra de fleubotomia es salva de flux de sanc e de inscizio de nervi, e es pus lausabla e pus salva que fleubotomia segon latitut e longitut.	This method of phlebotomy avoids the flow of blood and the cutting of nerves, and is more advisable and safer than phlebotomy according to length and width.
E a la qual es acostumat sobrevenir sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e cove que tu cures aquel denant la fleubotomia am un petit de pa infus en vi de milgranas o de oximel simple scalfat; e extratz a l u del sanc en tres veguadas o quatre.	And to which it is customary for fainting to occur, before the phlebotomy, take a little of wine of millet grains or of simple chamomile; and extract from the upper part of the blood in three or four draws.
E si es enfregiditat de compleccio, lahoras prengua denant la fleubotomia pa infus en eyssarop de mirra o en eyssarop de mel aromatizat am specias ayssi cum am pebre, canela, gingiebre e semblantz, o en eyssarop aromatizat e mot odorant.	And if there is a sensation of coldness, before the phlebotomy, take a drink of myrrh syrup or of aromatic honey syrup flavored with spices such as pepper, cinnamon, ginger, and saffron, or an aromatic and fragrant syrup.
E si accideys sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e es causa de lu issiment de mot sanc, lahoras cove que prengua en beure aygua de carn e eyssarop mot odorant subtil; e use de aromaticitat am algualea, e sia linit le sieu pietz am aquela.	And if fainting occurs, avoid the phlebotomy, as it is caused by the passage of thick blood, then it is advisable to drink water from meat and a fragrant subtle syrup; use its aroma, and place his foot in that.
E usa de las autras causas que havem ditas en la divisio en le capitol de sincopi per evacuacio.	And use the other causes that we have said in the division in the chapter on fainting by evacuation.
E qui vol eventar le sieu bras e dissolver le sieu sanc segonda veguada, cove a lu del qual la fleubotomia es per mota evacuacio, e la vertut de lu es freol, que evacue le sanc petit a petit, so es segon la quantitat de la vertut en les dias continuables.	And here you want to cool his arm and dissolve his blood for the second time, incise him from which the phlebotomy is by major evacuation, and its virtue is refrigerant, that evacuates the blood little by little, so it depends on the quantity of its virtue in the continuous days.
Mays qui vol eventar le sieu bras, e gitar lo sieu sanc segonda vetz, e le sieu cors es fort, lahoras fassa aquo aprop vii horas o ix de la primieyra fleubotomia.	And if you want to cool his arm and draw his blood for the second time, and his body is strong, then do this about seven or nine hours after the first phlebotomy.
Mays qui vol atirar le sanc del cors sieu al contrari de la partida a la qual declina, cove que sia eventat en le segon dia o le tertz.	And if you want to draw the blood from his body in the opposite direction of the part where it declines, do so when it is cooled on the second day or the third.
Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent.	And if that body in which there is hot blood already scalded and heated, causing a fever, draw the blood from it all at once in one time, and let a large quantity be drawn, and intensify the feeling when you are about to cause syncope; for you should have all the conditions of phlebotomy preserved; and place your hand on the pulse, to prevent the body from dying instead of causing syncope, because several times this should be done when the phlebotomist is ignorant and negligent.
E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal.	And do not withdraw when you want to remove the arm and evacuate the blood for a second time, as the openings of the vein are already closed and it is difficult for the blood to issue forth, that you press upon it with firmness and slightly extend it, for this is too much evil.
Habantz le layssa entro que sia fleubotomat segondament; o remau aquo am la acuitat del fleubotomi que es coagulat del sanc en le orrifici de la vena; o pausa sobre aquel de tyriaca alfarach, o de sagzenea, e comprem aquel am compressio leugiera entro que·l sanc sia fora yssit.	Let it remain in the state of being phlebotomized according to the rule; or keep what is left from the sharpness of the phlebotomy that has coagulated the blood in the openings of the vein; or place over it a compress of tyriaca alfalfa, or sagenea, and cover it with a light compression until the blood is settled.
E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.	And if the vein is inflamed, let that be and do not touch it until the inflammation is subsided.
E si necessitat te provoca a evacuar le sanc segondament, e no es excusacio, lahoras tu sagna aquel sobre aquel loc o en l’autre bras en autra vena.	And if necessity prompts you to evacuate the blood again, and there is no excuse, then let that (arm) bleed in that same place or in the other arm at another vein.
E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas.	And the vein called "funis del bras" is phlebotomized in place of the funica or basilica, when they are not found or are hidden, for it is composed of those.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	The quality of the phlebotomy for him is that the patient inserts his hand in cold water after the vein has become red and visibly appears.
E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut.	And then bind tightly over that area with astringent; and then perform phlebotomy according to the transverse small vein, neither longitudinally nor laterally.
E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	And let the incision be wide, and let your phlebotomy be in the area where you performed it over the joint of the hand.
E si es prohibit le fluxs del sanc, lahoras tu itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e layssa le sanc correr en la aygua entro que consieguas la tua necessitat.	And if the flow of blood is stopped, then repeatedly immerse your hand in cold water and let the blood run into the water until you achieve your necessity.
Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	But if you are in the days of summer, then you are excused from repeatedly immersing your hand in cold water, and it is better to let the body cool the blood in cold water during winter.
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And the phlebotomy of this vein is safer than of all other veins, for it has no pulsating vein or nerve.

De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Of ventilation and of the qualities of using those.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Ventilations are of the lungs, or of the heart, or of the eyes.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	Ventilation is performed according to two methods: one involves scarification and the extraction of blood, and the other is ventilation without scarification.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this ventilation without scarification is performed according to two methods, either with fire or by fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And for ventilations that are administered with scarification and the extraction of blood, there are fourteen locations on the body. E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And ventilation you extract the blood only from the small veins scattered in the flesh, and by this do not lose the virtue by those, as is done with flebotomy; nor should you think that ventilation should be made by fire or several fires in any illness caused by repletion within which the body is completely evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	But if necessity provokes ventilation for illness or continuously, administer that at the beginning of the month and at the end, and in the middle of it, and at any other time.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The cause is that in those men where blood is multiplied within and cannot be extracted by ventilation, they find great weight and hardness; of those who find repletion and redness on their face and head, and on their neck; of those who find pain on their face and forehead, as well as darkness and stupidity in their eyes; of those who change the location of their ventilation; of those whose laughter is multiplied; of those who find taste of blood in their mouth, or whose tongue swells and they spit blood; of those who sleep more, and of those who see blood in their sleep as redness, spots, and other causes similar to them.

Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What must be done before causing a bowel movement and phlebotomy.
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	Ensure that you consider the beginning: if the person who needs to have a bowel movement or is to be phlebotomized is choleric and has acute pain and inflammation, then ensure that they take cooling causes, such as sweet milky whey, endive with vinegar, and syrups of myrrh, julep, and similar remedies.

E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And it seems to work when applied to the liver and spleen in cases of local swelling.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	And these cupping tools are applied with suction only; sometimes they are applied with fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And sometimes they are applied full of clear water in diseases of the spleen.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And this is to ensure that the cupping tool is full and larger, so it should be clear water or water in which suitable herbs have been added.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form a ventosa with fire: let the width of the orifici be two fingers, as we have formed it; and the amount of the preon be half a palm; and place it in its center, in the location that is on the circuit, take it small according to the quantity that enters it one needle.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	Let it be made of leather or citrus, of thick edges, lion skin, equal and thin so that it does not lead the member to lose its position over it.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And let it be at the middle of the leather or iron cross, where the candle is placed over the fire.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And let this ventosa be much larger than the one we have described; and the smaller amount of it according to the ailments and the condition of the one who uses it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the ventosas for children and those who are weak are different from those for young and strong individuals.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the quality of placing this ventosa on fire over the member is to extend the heat from the fire of decent wood in front of a small wax candle, and place that one at the middle of the cross transversely in the middle location of the ventosa, so that the fire is ignited around the area left by the ventosa to prevent the patient's body from being burned.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And then place yourself over the limb of the patient, and tell them about what we have said, within which when we have the vents and do not intend for them to hold the said and that vapor rises above that vent, then the vent will soon be dissolved.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And then heat the iron according to its manner, and repeat it if you need to do so.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	More specifically for the ventosa (cupping) used in the illness of pleurisy, it should be applied with water, in which there is no transverse scar or vent, and it should not be applied unless it is filled with water, and is placed over the limb only for a short time.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is the form of it: And this cupping device should be as large as possible, because it can then receive a greater quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Capitol. xcvi.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Sanguissuguas are not administered in large members but in the members in which it is not possible to place cupping devices due to their small size, such as the palate and similar parts; or on a member devoid of flesh, such as the nose and similar areas.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those that you have found leeches in the waters downstream from the bathhouse.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And after letting the day and night pass in water downstream where they are familiar, and ensuring no cause of stagnation in their belly; and then evacuating the body at the beginning with phlebotomy and fomentations; and rubbing the limb of the patient until it becomes reddened; and placing them over it.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are full and swollen.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if possible, apply fomentation to the area with the ventosa, more so in youth.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, then wash the area with warm water and immediately apply cold water; and rub and express it.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the bleeding from the body persists at the site of the leech application, then insert a cloth soaked in cold water, and place it there until the residue is absorbed.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the bleeding is increased, then powder vitriol trissat or similar substances to those causing vasoconstriction over it while the bleeding is being reduced; or place hot pea pods on the area and let them remain until the peas adhere to the area, and then let the bleeding cease.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And if necessary, iteration of bloodletting, when possible change those.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if bloodletting is prohibited by suspension, then wet the area with fresh blood or leave a needle in the areas until it clots with blood; and place them there, so that when any blood flows, it stops quickly.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to constrict, powder a little aloes trissat, or salt, or ashes over them, and apply it quickly.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begin the procedures of the first part: restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is necessary knowledge in the art of medicine; and it deals with the restoration of fractures and dislocations in bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh, son, know that both the learned doctors and the common folk, as well as those who for some time have not studied the works of the Ancients or read them even a letter, boast about this chapter.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason, this method of the scientists in our land is kept private; and I have not forgotten it even after a long time; and I have not acquired what follows except through much reading of the works of the Ancients and study over their understanding, from which I extracted the science.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And I have directed this experiment and study over the length of my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already described in this chapter all that concerns my science and on which my experiment has passed; now I abbreviate this for you others and deliver it from long narration; and abbreviate it at the end of abbreviation; and shown it at the end of declaration; and compiled in this various forms of instruments that are administered there, as is done by addition of declaration, just as I have done in two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	First chapter.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summarize and collect the details of bone fractures, those for which a preliminary treatment is necessary before we begin recalling the various parts of the fractured members.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore, let us begin this chapter with the summary of the discourse; and the chapters for which understanding is necessary at the beginning are those that the artisans must stand upon the truth of. It is you and these who are prompt to know or learn this noble art from others.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And therefore say that when you encounter a fracture or dislocation or twisting or setting, then you must attend to the beginning with venesection or reduce it, or both, if no cause prohibits, such as weakness of virtue, or in that which is affected, or very in decrepitude, or at the time of intense heat or intense inflammation.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And furthermore, let it be in food such as herbs, fresh herbs, and meat of partridges and crabs; and prohibit fatty meats and those full of food, especially avoid foods that fill the veins with sanguine matter, until you are sure of no abscess. And if you fear effusion of matter in the member.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the patient to his first primary position according to the custom of doing so.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And so, when the broken bone begins to be restored, then ensure that the patient is fed nutritious foods rich in both fine and heavy nutrients with viscosity, such as foods made from cooked wheat in water, rice, eggs, fish, cattle stomachs, nuts, fresh meat, and thick substances similar to these. And with this regimen, coagulation of the fracture is induced slightly with honey.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And know that the bones crack in those who are in their prime and in the elderly, it is not possible for them to be cured and consolidated according to their nature due to the drying out of their limbs.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are consolidated and cured according to their nature at all times due to the drying out of those limbs, and they are cured and consolidated those that are of them in the end of youth, such as the bones of young animals.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	But nature adjusts and ameliorates the broken bone from any part due to a cause similar to glue in which there is thickening that adheres and strengthens it together with conglutination, bringing about the end of strength and firmness, such as fire at the beginning, and for no reason do you prevent it from its works.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason, it is necessary to place the patient on their side, on foods in which there is density, viscosity, and bulkiness, as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	Various types of fracture according to the part of the body.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And know that the types of fracture are diverse according to the diversity of the limbs, for a fracture of the thigh bone is different from a fracture of the skull bone; and a fracture of the foot bone is different from a fracture of the arm bone; and similarly, all other limbs are different among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I will recall all types of fractures, each explained in its own distinct chapter.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	Various types of fracture within itself.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And the types of fracture in bones are diverse; for some fractures occur arcuately or where the stars intersect; and sometimes fractures occur according to the length of the bone: such as the transverse, oblique, and comminuted fractures that occur when preparing to write a pen, fractures by slicing and disruption in the head, and small fissure-type fractures.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And for each case there is a specific engagement or torture in restoration of it according to the distinct recall in their places.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	A sign of fracture of the bone.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And for this, the fracture of the bone is known: there is a tortuosity in it, and an elevation and prominence of it upon feeling, and the pain felt when you press on that area with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And when there is neither apparent tortuosity nor pain, you should touch the bone with agitation and if the patient does not experience great pain, then it is not a fracture.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	It is possible that it is tortuosity or a small fracture. Therefore, touch the area with your hand and apply compression all around; then place your hand over the medicine of which you recall just at that moment, which suits the location; and it will be straightened by subtle contraction.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And you will know that the area when it is arched and does not split into two or another such thing that does not happen in the interval, as all parts of its composition are inflamed, then you should begin your correction at the beginning and apply a blistering cautery to it.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if an abscess occurs at that place, then leave it for some days until the abscess subsides; and then treat it in any way you can to promote healing and discharge.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And know that the restoration and ligation of it are lighter than dealing with the place where the accident occurred.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And then strengthen it according to the recall of the remedy that will come.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	More so if in the bone there is a fracture, then it is necessary to extend this broken member into two parts, whether it be the hand or the foot; or with your hand if the member is small; or with two cords or one cord and your hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And place your hand in such a way that you hold the member firmly according to its natural shape, while the parts are extended from the broken member, then force yourself to return those connections with care and in any way you can at their respective places.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And guard yourself so that your operation does not cause pain or injury to the patient; and force yourself according to your power to apply one bone to its companion bone according to their best forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And ensure that at that profitable hour you touch it with your hand, and if you see any other cause different, correct it and equalize it according to the quantity of your virtue.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And avoid excessive extension and compression, as foolish doctors sometimes cause abscesses due to their operations or cause contractions in the limb, as we have seen through their operations.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And ensure the connection, achieve equilibrium and a proper operation of that limb, and rest and tranquility; advise the patient about this and make sure they do not aggravate it during their waking hours and while sleeping, and observe its revolution and agitation, and direct its egestion, and all of its movements with your entire virtue; wait until the position of the limb is in a position where the pain is secured, as the cause of the pain or injury is due to its positioning. When this occurs, ensure you change it to another position where there is no pain; and observe that the position of the limb is straight and equal, so that when it is restored, the limb does not incur tortuosity.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	The quality of the fracture of the injured limb is what I recommend; that you know that the limbs broken vary in their smallness and in their largeness and in the form of those.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And of those that are small like the forearm and the thigh and similar to those, see that the wrapping is of soft fine cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	But of those that are large like the thigh or the chest, see that in those there is a wrapping hard and tight, for the firm binding connects the large and strong member from all sides at the fracture equally, try that no spot is left untreated.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And then begin, as you start your dressing, apply three or four wraps conveniently over the place of that fracture; and keep your hand a little tight on the wrapping.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And then place it at the uppermost part of the location of the fracture, and keep it tight so that your binding is firm where you have tightened the location of the fracture.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And then slightly extend the covering of the fracture area, gradually soften the tension little by little, while you remove a significant part from the location.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And then take another bandage and wrap the other part over the fractured area covered by the first bandage, and gradually align the bandages to the position of the fracture; and let the operation be on the tension of the bandage and in the softening of that according to what we have said in the first bandage above.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And then place the folds of the bandage or cloth equal to the tortuosity of the fracture, if there is any tortuosity; otherwise, do not fold it for any reason.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And then place it over the other bandage, and gradually equalize over these properly made splints if there is no swelling or abscess in that location. Otherwise, place it over what constitutes the abscess there and which causes the swelling; leave that for a few days, and then strengthen the splints.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And let the stitches of the thigh on the right side be formed sagely; or be of hemp thread; or of palm fiber; and let the width of each stitch follow this form and figure:
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, ensure that the stitch placed over that fracture is thicker and a little longer than the other stitches, and the length of the thread according to what is read about the member in size and minuteness; and then strengthen on top of the threads with another bandage according to your first stricture; and further apply honey decently on top according to how we said about stricture, and it should be your stricture most where the fracture is, and the more it is lengthened from the fracture, the less the stricture.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And ensure that the threads are medium in thickness and fineness, and be of good quality; if the threads are thick, as I have seen in the operation where some used their fingers to place the cords of sinew, it is a great error when applying the stricture at equality.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And equally thin threads are not convenient, for you will not be able to apply the stricture where you want, and it must not be less than a finger's width between stitches.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is injured at the extremities of the vessels near the location, then place those of stopa leon or fine wool between them so that this does not harm the area.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Some fractures are caused by a blow, and accidents causing disruption in the chain, and I will recall this in that at the Capitol according to their singularity.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And know that for any broken member, it is not straightened with wires on the first day; this cause is that the member, when large, cannot be held still by wires but should wait a few days or seven or more, according to your safety of the onset of abscess.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the method of plasters that the Ancients used to restore, which are applied over fractures and dislocations.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Method of plastering for the reduction of fractures, convenient for complex cases and especially for women and children, which is applied to that upon which no heat or friction: and it is that you take powder of millstone, which is the marrow of the flour that hangs from the movement of the mill in the walls of the mill.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And you must confect it thusly, but sieve the white of egg, and place the confection not-thin nor subtle; then use that.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another way to plaster for fractures, dislocations, and sprains: recipe of asafetida, of lapdanum, of acacia, of onion, and myrrh, which is razed from salvages milgrain, all of it in drachms x; of myrrh and aloes in drachms v; alcohol in drachms xx; all are crushed and sieved and mixed with alcohol water or with the white of egg if the wound of the patient is scabby; then use this plaster, which is of good composition, and restores broken bones lightly, and you apply it to men.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another way to plaster which restores fractures and sprains: recipe myrrh and half of white althaea in drachms x; of myrrh and aloes in drachms v; of acacia in drachms vi; of Armenian bole in drachms .xx.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	All are crushed in a mortar with much mixture, and sieved, and compounded with water or with the white of egg and is administered.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Method to apply plaster to joints and bones separated from their places, and for accidental pain in those and for cracks and fractures: take pure wool and immerse it in strong wine and oil infused and place it over the area.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	But in this plaster there is not the virtue of restoration, but rather for the removal of abscesses and to relieve pain properly.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another method of plaster that restores broken bones: take leaves of fig tree and leaves of wild poppy; mix them all together and make a plaster from them.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida i; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	Method of a brief plaster to be applied when you want restoration of bone fracture and when you desire resolution of abscess: take parts of centaury, chamomile, and violet flowers, part of flour of radish; mix all together and steep them in wine, if the member is not scalded.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	But if it is scalded, then soak that in fennel water or in water and use it.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another method of applying a stronger plaster for resolution when the abscess is hard: take a powder of althea and seed of flax, of balsam, melilot, marjoram, flowers of violet, chamomile, all in equal parts and ground; all be sifted and mixed with water of sage or water must or wine, according to the quality of the limb and the color thereof.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	May Ypocras not advise placing a compress over the limb soaked to promote its restoration, but a plaster made of wax and oil; and he recommends that it be mixed between coarseness and subtlety.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	May Gualia be seen as having compresses placed over the broken limb to promote its restoration and the causes in which desiccation with little heat, such as myrrh, frankincense, and similar substances, operate similarly to those causes we have recommended.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	Method of plaster that comforts injury and pain: take equal parts of myrrh, slices of human skin incised or quince bark, althea, and salt; sift and grind them all equally; mix to make a plaster.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	When the quantity according to which it should be cut and then disjointed is determined, you should consider whether there has been no pain neither puncture nor bone broken outside its place, then you do not disjoint for several days.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if pain intense or puncture or inflammation occurs at its place, then you should cut or disjoint it immediately, and apply a plaster to it.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	And take a cloth of linen and marine sponge soaked in thick wine, submerge that in strong vinegar, and apply it to the area until the puncture and pain are alleviated; then place the limb at rest for an hour; afterwards, put it on with woolen cloth submerged in olive oil or rubbed oil, and bind it overnight until you are sure of no abscess forming, and reduce the inflammation of the limb, and relieve the pain.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then repeatedly apply that fine plaster and do not bind it tightly with your first binding, but keep it subtle until it is healed.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if you see that the abscess, redness, pain, inflammation, and all other accidents have been relieved of everything, and no plaster or binding is needed, then repeat that as you did at the beginning equally.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o vii; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if no cause occurs to the member of those we have said, then release it in no more than three or four days or five or seven; sometimes all this is left for twenty days according to how you appear by the release of the member, as we have said, until the fracture adheres and comes to the coagulation of the flesh over that.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And then adjust the larger stricture more than in your first stricture, and adjust to the enlargement of the patient's abdomen, according to whether the memory of it preceded.
